Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MatnJules
Reviews.Content: We arrived before normal check-in time and as our room was not ready, we were happy to pay for the upgrade offered, and were taken to our room on the 10th floor. Some of the rooms on the floor were under renovation, and our was clearly overdue to be renovated. The carpet was soiled and stained and the room smelled of stale tobacco. Work seemed to be going on through the night as we could hear banging and talking through the thin walls. We had to navigate through open, dangerous working areas under renovation to get to the breakfast room. The highlight of the Nathan Hotel during our visit was 'Nathan's Cellar' which was a nice retreat after a hot day out. Would not recommend this hotel at this point, but perhaps after the renovations are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Judi2607
Reviews.Content: I went to Nathan hotel after reading a lot of positive comments. I would say that the hotel is average: comfort bedrooms but nothing exceptional for a 4 stars. My biggest regret was the location. Located in Kow Loon you have to walk a lot to go to the Pier and take the ferry to go to Hong Kong itself. I I had to go back there, I would pay more to be in CENTRAL even if the room is smaller and more expensive. Location is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a quick visit to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Chrazyfella
Reviews.Content: We had a quick stop over in Hong Kong on our way from Australia to Paris. We booked the hotel through our travel agent at home. It was fairly affordable, not sure exactly what we paid now. We stayed in a superior room which was just your basic hotel room. Neat and tidy. Large flat screen tv with cable channels. Reasonable sized bathroom with shower/bath. The hotel is in a great location. We walked down to the harbour and ferry terminal in the morning 15mins walk. Then got the MTR up to mongkok for the markets, then walked back. Again about 15 mins. So the location was great for a quick visit. Breakfast was included. A selection of pastries, omelette chef, bacon, beans, noodles, fruits, salad and cereals. The price was 98hkd if you don't have it included. So I think that was good. We had a little trouble speaking English with the staff but we got it sorted after a few minutes of confusion. The bed was a little hard, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel090
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found it an easy place to base ourselves in Hong Kong. It is so close to the night market and airport express, as the stop is right outside the hotel. We were upgraded to a family suit which is almost as good as having another bedroom for my daughter. We will recommend this hotel to other travelers

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALU FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: marcgrimaldi
Reviews.Content: I appreciated a lot my stay at Nathan Hotel. The room on the 9th floor was very nice and, at this floor, the Nathan Lounge with TV, newspapers, Internet stations and complimentary drinks was very pleasant. I really recommand this hotel. Only regret : for the first time in Hong Kong (it was my 43th stay...) the hotel didn't provide the French channel TV5Monde, it' a pity and the hotel has to make a small effort on this point.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: perfectionist-freak
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Train station is just within 5-10 minutes walk away and there are lots of different shops on the main streets. Famous food stalls were also nearby, within 5-10 minutes away. Basically, you can walk to most of the Kowloon attractions (the markets, food shops, etc) if you are the kind who likes walking. Room wise, quite modern and feels clean. Room size wise, it was bigger than we had expected. Because based on other experiences of hotels in Hong Kong, we expected the room to be really small. Yet, it was still comfortable for 3 of us (with an extrabed placed in). Service staff were also quite helpful to assist with directions. We cannot speak Cantonese and they were able to converse in Mandarin or English with us quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: fire-tower
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family and we took 3 Nathan Rooms on the Nathan Floor. These rooms, though small, was comfortable and nicely renovated. Guests staying in rooms on the Nathan Floors were given access to the Nathan Lounge, which provided a nice and quiet place to surf the net (2 desktops were available), read magazines and newspapers, or to have a nice cuppa (tomato and grapefruit juice were available too). Breakfast provided is decent, but there are few tables that can accomodate large groups. Then again, In terms of location, the hotel is located along Nathan Road but smack in between 2 MTR stations. Nonetheless, the short walk to the MTR and the ease of catching public buses outside the hotel make getting around convenient. In addition, there is a 7-11 and a famous cha chang teng (cafeteria) nearby. Temple Street is also just across the main thoroughfare, which also has quite a few eateries along the night market. The staff here are friendly, and when requested, they will help you call for a taxi and tell the taxi driver where you are heading. In our case, they even helped us get 2 taxis, and negotiated a flat fare for our trip to the airport. The fare we payed was less than what we would have paid for if we had taken the Airport Express (bus-train to the airport). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Nathan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Mazaaaj
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful as well. the room was mmmmmm oky.... but the view from the window was horrible loooool. the location is the best thing in this hotel. well, generally i recommend it for friends

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: DCSimian
Reviews.Content: Had a business trip to Hong Kong and my colleague recommended staying at the Nathan Hotel on the Kowloon side. As the name suggests, the hotel is located off of Nathan Road, between Yau Mei Tai and Jordan MTR stops. Convenient and very close to sites and markets. Service was excellent. We were booked for a Nathan Grand and were immediately upgraded to a Nathan Studio Suite! Room was very spacious, comfortable and quiet. Well decorated as well. Morning breakfast was delicious and the staff was very helpful with recommendations throughout the visit. The prices weren't outrageous for what you get, especially given the size of the rooms. Very clean as well. The Nathan floor even had a nice reading lounge. Wife loved it as well and wouldn't hesitate coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Stay we were hoping for”
Reviews.Author: NicolasBkk
Reviews.Content: We Hesitated between Langham place and Nathan hotel but I had to do some business in the area of Nathan so we decided to stay there. I booked on the Hotel website as the hotel looked very nice. Arrived at the Nathan hotel at night (side road entrance). The room is nice and Spacious (I think we booked an executive) and on the 12th Floor. No real view per se. Great Room, comfortable bed and we had a good night sleep. Weekend started pretty well. The next morning we went to Breakfast and boy oh boy was it quite a shock! I work in the Hotel Business, in Thailand and I would be ashamed to serve such food and have such a poor breakfast selection for the price we paid. 2 star at best. Unfortunately for us, this was not the end of our surprises! we went out to walk and shop then came back to take a nap before going out to dinner. However our nap was interrupted by what sounded like Drilling Noises, hammering and plain Construction. It turned out the 14th floor (just above us) was in renovations. Now I don't have anything against renovations, but as we booked via the Hotel website we did not see anything mentioned, when we checked-in the hotel we were not warned that they had renovations going on (one Floor above us!!!). This, by any standards, is highly unprofessional from the hotel's part. On the 14th floor, when we were going for Breakfast, we saw the construction workers come into the public areas, with no shirt on. Appalling. We went down to Reception and talked to the Manager who apologized and offered to move us to the 9th floor. Really??? even more unprofessional, if you have renovations, why not put your customers on the 9th floor to begin with? Being in the hotel business managing 5 star properties, I was very disappointed with my stay at the Nathan Hotel. Room is nice but the poor quality of the breakfast and poor service made our stay very uncomfortable. In hindsight, we should have stayed at the Langham place! we went there and it is a million times better than the Nathan. Will make sure to AVOID this place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to all markets, train lines and buses.”
Reviews.Author: Aussiebackpackers7
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, trainline close by. Buses right at door step. Walking distances to night markets and shopping centres. Some of the workers struggled with English and giving right directions for things but overall good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dal04
Reviews.Content: Hotel is spacious and facilities in the room are good especially the bathtub which my kids like & the free WIFI! Hotel staffs are friendly and if you happen to meet Leo if I am not wrong who is the bellboy, he can help you arrange taxi transport to the airport at around HK$230 for 4-5 pax per cab. Overall I had a good stay there with my family :)!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: joelouise75
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Nathan , not grand by any means but really good value for money. As said before the rooms are a good size for HK & Wang the lovely lady who made it spotless every day was without fault. Front desk staff , tour guide & concierge more than helpful. The Nathan Cellar ... well worth an evening or two there especially the Wine Buffet - has to be the best value in town as generally alcohol consumption in HK is expensive. The only negative's - The Bali Bar ( Why Bali ? ) lacks ambiance & the hot breakfast dishes were generally not hot enough. Having said that the gentleman who oversees the dining area was fantastic. Location is perfect if you wish to be in the centre of authentic Kowloon - everything so close & without the more sterile landscape of Tsim Sha Tsui & the upmarket shopping precinct around Star Ferry. MTR & frequent buses to anywhere you wish to go are at the doorstep. For anything Optical you have to visit Mongkok Optical - ask for Raymond , he's fantastic. 18/F , Mongkok Metro , 594-596 Nathan Rd , Kowloon (Spaghetti House upstairs) Love HK , can't wait to be there again !

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: holidaymanSingapore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location and it is easy to walk to mongkok. The rooms were large with a big tv. Much cheaper to book through other websites than the hotel.The concierge provides very good tips and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Kowloon stay, well located”
Reviews.Author: CheekyChops_xoxo
Reviews.Content: Nathan Hotel is a great base for a Kowloon stay. We arrived very early in the morning so we had to leave our bags in reception and go wander the city for a while before our room was available. During this walk we discovered the MTR stations were very close by, as were markets and great eateries/restaurants. While we waited for check in, we had Yum Cha at a place directly opposite the hotel just across the road and browsed the Jade Market. I was traveling with a group of 7 and my group consisted of family and friends. We had 3 rooms between us, 3 single beds in my room, 2 doubles in the second room and the third had a queen sized bed. Our room with the three single beds was very large, spacious and was clean. I had a great nights sleep every night, the pillows so comfy. The bathroom was clean and the hot water did not run out. The room had an electronic safe, TV with limited cable channels and easy access to free wifi for guests all throughout the hotel. It also had a mini bar fridge and a tiny freezer section. The bar on the lower floor was nice, we met for drinks there one night but most nights we went for happy hour in the Bali Bar on the roof top. The staff were very friendly and allowed us to enjoy happy hour beyond the designated end time. The staff looked after us. Most nights we went to the Temple Street markets to eat, as it was only a short walk away, and a short taxi trip over to the Star Ferry Terminal and the Harbour. The MTR is excellent to get around and over to Hong Kong Island, easy day trips were had using the MTR network. I would come back to this hotel in the future. The hotel staff were inviting, friendly and helpful, and the room was very comfortable and clean. After many long and tiring days full of sight seeing and adventure, i always felt comfortable and well rested each night. A great base for our Kowloon stay, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience...”
Reviews.Author: Blackgoh
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Nathan Twin Room for 5 nights. The room is spacious and cosy (compared to Hong Kong Average Hotel Room), however, the toilet is relatively small. The location is convenience and it is about 5 to 10 minutes walk to Jordan MTR station. Harbor City Mall is about 1.4km away from the hotel. The room package comes with breakfast for 2 pax and unlimited usage of Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan Hotel...great place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: phenry999
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3-day stay at the Nathan Hotel, my second in a 60 day period. Based on these two experiences I am abandoning all the other hotels I have stayed in HK over the past 30 years and will opt for the Nathan from now on. Staff are super friendly and most important competent and professional. The rooms are very clean and also comfortable. The food is great, location is great....about 5 minutes from Temple Street with every kind of food you can name. And also only a 10 minute walk to the Jordan MRT Station. Oh yes...the price is an utter value.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in HK”
Reviews.Author: mazveronese
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nathan Hotel on the last leg of our awesome 8 week overseas engagement, wedding and honeymoon jaunt. It was a great way to finish as the service, facilities and hospitality was excellent. Very typically Hong kong; efficient, hustling, fast but very friendly. Also very close to the MTR and just across Nathan Rd from the Temple St night markets. We were upgraded whilst staying there and nothing was a problem for the staff. Definitely a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tellingitlikeiseeit
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights in May 2012 at approx AUD$120 per night and thought it was good value. The hotel is located in Kowloon, the major shopping area of Hong Kong's northern side, which is busy with traffic, shops and restaurants open until around 11pm. Despite the area being busy the rooms were quiet. The area seemed very safe with so many people around. There is a train station about 5-10 minutes walk away which gives quick access to most of Hong Kong. The staff spoke enough english to understand and be understood and were pleasant and helpful. The hotel was nicely decorated. The room was compact but comfortable. Lights and airconditioning were controlled via an electronic remote which broke down one evening but was fixed by my return the next evening. Airconditioning was excellent and I thought this was really important given Hong Kong weather was hot and humid during the stay. The room was clean but on one occassion I saw a giant bug (looked like a cockroach) on the carpet floor of the hotel corridor. Given the overall high level of cleanliness of the hotel, I'm guessing this was brought in by a guest and promptly removed by staff. The bed was comfortable but had no cover sheet to pull over while sleeping (only a quilt). The hotel supplied a UK to Australian power adapter in room which I thought was considerate. Buffet breakfast in the hotel was tasty and good value at approx AUD$12. The "business centre" turned out to be just a couple of PCs in small booths in the lobby, only one had a functioning printer.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location. Breakfast and aircon could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: defiant_dilly
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Nathan Hotel is a good base for a Hong Kong holiday. The Good - Close to many eateries and shops. Short walk to MTR station to get to anywhere in Hong Kong. Booked 2 rooms for 3 nights with breakfast for a great price and were given 2 huge interconnecting rooms (even for Hong Kong standards) which was great. Can't fault the staff, from the front desk to the breakfast crew, they had a smile and seemed to want to work there. The internet worked fine. The Bad - The airconditioning in both rooms were noisy and not cool enough. Also, if you are a light sleeper, the rooms facing Nathan Road might be noisy. (We were on the 5th floor). About the breakfast, I wouldn't pay HK$98 considering what is available around the hotel. The bamboo placemats on the tables should be cleaned more regularly so small pieces of food are not left there. Not that you go to HK to watch TV but the quality of the picture (fuzzy with lines) could be better to make use of the 47in LCD.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: Nathan Hotel Hong Kong is a very fine place to stay, I had a very pleasant 3 nights stay in this cosy and friendly place during my Australian school vacation. The rooms were spacious and very clean. All the staffs are very helpful and have great knowledge of Hong Kong. There are many wonderful eateries near by and the best place to shop for diamonds. There is a beautiful jewellery shop on the ground floor at this hotel. Breakfast was served at the top floor of the hotel and there was very good selections of cereals for the hotel guests. I would love to revisit this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosie7585
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ok location for shopping etc in Hong Kong. The room we had was supposedly upgraded but it was very average despite this and I would have to say that this hotel doesn't offer great value for money. The room charge included breakfast which was quite good and the free wifi was a bonus. I would describe this hotel as very average and although it was awful, I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattBarcelona
Reviews.Content: As several other reviewers have mentioned, got upgraded to a large room (as we were staying for 6 nights). Whilst not the swankiest of Hong Kong hotels, it is more than OK - great location, with a really good breakfast, extremely friendly and helpful staff, small but functional gym, quiet, near the MTR, so all in all would thoroughly recommend it for good value stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that never disappoint me.”
Reviews.Author: Traveleddict
Reviews.Content: I lost count on my number of times to Hong Kong. But Nathan Hotel after so many years is still my number 1 choice hotel in Hong Kong. It is located conveniently close to food and shopping areas. The thing about this hotel is, the staffs are always very welcoming. After so many years and turnover of staffs, they still maintain the good standard of hospitality. Thumbs up for the management for keeping the tradition going. This time round, i choose the executive room from my usual Nathan room. It is located just below the restaurant, the room is well maintained and clean. No complaint about the room area, so far the most comfortable size compared to other hotels in Kowloon. The only setback about having a room below the restaurant is the noise of dragging tables and chairs all the time. So my opinion is try to avoid the top floor if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jurief
Reviews.Content: Good location, on Nathan Road one of the best roads to walk and shop on in Hong Kong. Close to Metro stations, Staff were reasonable. We showed up a bit early at the hotel and was allowed a upgrade for a bit cheaper, we took it and the room as nice. Modern and large enough for the city, where hotels rooms are generally smaller. I think the cheaper one might have been a bit small if we had stayed in it. The photo's of the rooms are definitely stretched a bit on the website to make them look bigger... The breakfast was nice, but it could have been better. Hong Kong Its self is a wonderful destination. We had no problem with street noise in our room. There was a door linking us to our next door neighbours, and we could clearly hear the music from the television. So in that instance it was not very private. Some of the other guests complained about the elevator service. Too slow, congested etc. In general it was as described "Nice location, average hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Kowloon.”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Big-Cat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in Kowloon. Close to the MTR and Ferry station. Obviously there is heaps do do on Nathan road but there are also loads of other great restaurants in the area. The room we had was very large with a separate sitting room - kind of weird actually but nice and comfortable. Well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Value for Money/Clean/Nice Staffs/Good Room Size for a Hotel in HKG.”
Reviews.Author: AshuraSylviane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Nathan Hotel Grand Room with Balcony for 5 nights in October/Novemeber 2011. Staffs were great and helpful. Even the travel desk in the lobby was very friendly and provided us with a lot of information. We arrived hkg very early so our room was not available but we get to go to the Nathan Lounge to rest and use the facilities with complimentary drinks available. Generally, HKG's hotels are mostly small and the rooms are not very spacious, so we did not have high expectation on the room size. To our surprise, the grand room is bigger than I thought even though it is not very big, but it is enough for us. Other than the usual supplies, they even provide toothpaste, mouthwash, bath robes, slippers, dvd player, speakers for your gadgets and stationery in a leather stationery case! Location of the hotel is excellent! Just a few mins walk to Jordan station so it is very easy to get around in hkg. 35-45Mins to Disneyland, 2 - 3 stops away from hkg Island Central or Causeway Bay. Walking distance to Temple Street Night Market and Ladies' Market (Tung Choi Street)!! Breakfast is not good but then again, who eats breakfast in the hotel when it is a practice in hkg to have breakfast in the coffee shops (Cha Tsan Teng) and Dimsum restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ray267
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nathan Hotel for 8 nights in March of 2012. The hotel staff were great and very friendly throughout our stay. The breakfast was a little disappointing as there was not much of a variety. In saying that, the food itself was actually quite nice. We stayed in a room on the Nathan Floor which was comfortable and a good size. The bathroom was a little small but the cleanliness and newly furbished decor made up for that. The bed was extremely comfortable and the choice of inn room cable TV was also good. In terms of location, you can’t beat this hotel. It is a 5 minute walk to the Jordan MTR station and about a 25 minute walk down Nathan Road towards the Star ferry with plenty of shopping choices along the way. The hotel is within walking distance of both the Ladies Night Market and the Temple Street Market. I recommend going to both as you can get some really great items for a good price if your bartering skills are good. If you want good food go to Knustford Lane. This street is full of a variety of restaurants from Italian to Indian and even an Irish pub. I highly recommend eating at a restaurant called “Spice”. It is a Thai, Malay and Indian restaurant all in one. The food is spectacular and well priced. We ate there on 3 occasions during our stay! Knutsford Lane is about a 15 minute walk from the Nathan Hotel but well worth it. All in all we were very pleased with our stay at the Nathan Hotel and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay, needs a updating”
Reviews.Author: stewartsturges
Reviews.Content: We are actually here as I write, never having been to Hong Kong before we asked for recommendations as to the best place to stay , first was the Kowloon, then the YMCA. This place got a okay rap so as the other two were booked out we ended up here. Firstly, Hong Kong is busy, specifically Nathan road .. Our room was clean enough, but obviously tired, two different kinds of carpets on the floors and a heavy hand with the silicone sealer in the bathroom, but linen, beds and all that nice and clean. Our cleaning lady was super friendly, smiling and very helpful , very pretty too! The rest of the front of house staff tried with their limited english to be helpful, some far better than others, but all were cheerful and did their best to help. We paid extra for the breakfast, it was'nt much chop for anglicised or asian brekky, so I suggest you give it a miss and for the money, go into Nathan rd , turn right and walk a few steps to Main street coffee, excellent coffee, atmosphere and of course, free WIFI or use one if their computers, there is WIFI here too, but it can be dodgy .. There is WIFI everywhere even on public transport, so you'll always be connected. Rooms aren't super sound proof, our neighbors were a group of enthusiastic Chinese whose laughs and tells came through quite well and the little kids pitted patter up and down the corridors was annoying,especially at 11 pm. Television has limited channels but the idea is you'll be cruising the night markets, just across Nathan rd and a couple of streets over. Not far to Ladie's market and all those other ones up that way. Plus, go a few steps to the left, and one can get a number 6,2 or 6a down to the Star ferry wharf. So, in this regard the Nathan is pretty good. Just be aware that Hong Kong is a sea of concrete crawling with heaps of people, and Nathan road is a epicenter of shopping and commerce, so it'll always be noisy and full of traffic, and unless you go into New Territories or up the Peak.. All in all, the Nathan is decent value, good location and ticks the boxes for a quality time in Honkers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Executive Service at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Jana C
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend at Nathan Hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. I booked hotel through Agoda and experienced no problem at all. Check in was swift and and was very happy with their buffet breakfast as well. I chose to book at Nathan hotel because it is near Temple St. Night Market.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan Hotel - Downtown Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: pathawkins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on Nathan Road in download Kowloon. The staff were fantastic and we had a great time there. Room rates were very high due to the time of year with lots of exhibitions going on. Within walking distances of Temple Street and Ladies Markets and the local MTR stations is a 5 minute walk up Nathan Road to Jordan Station. StarBucks right next door with a door into the Hotel. Highly recommended to all that are seeking a place to stay that is close to everything. Taxi ride to the Airport HK300 or HK90 on the Airport Express after a HK30 ride to Kowloon Station - Pat Hawkins

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Joyful08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nathan Hotel for a night on Mar 18 to travel to Shenzhen the next day. We booked two executive rooms for HK$2678 but they upgraded us to rooms on Nathan Floor on the 12th floor. Nice gesture! Breakfast and wifi were included in the room rate. The rooms were surprisingly very large and spacious by HK's standards and they looked newly renovated. Our room had a partial view of Nathan Road but my children’s room did not have a view at all. All amenities, including tooth paste were provided. Buffet breakfast was adequate and good enough to start the day. No complaints since it was included in the room rate. There were many eateries, restaurants around the hotel and Temple Street is just few minutes away. Although the hotel is not very near to Jordan or Yau Ma Tei MTR station, there were many buses going to Tsimshatsui at the bus stop outside the hotel. The airport bus A21 stopped very near the hotel so it was very convenient. The hotel was very kind to store our luggages for 2 days even though we will not be checking in again. Plus point. The staff were helpful and friendly. Would recommend all to stay here if you are looking for a hotel in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with friendly & helpful staff in central location”
Reviews.Author: Samrica
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, friendly and obliging right from the start, esp porter Leo & receptionist Carrie. Got upgraded to a nice, roomy triple room (as there were 3 of us) but was told later on that there was extra charge for the 3rd person. I reminded them that my internet booking included free stay for child (11 yrs old) & they obliged after checking with the manager. At about NZ$250 a nite with free buffet breakfast (very good spread and normally cost HK$98 per person) in an ideal location with mostly nice, friendly staff & comfortable room, I think it's worth it. Just make sure you're not paying extra for what you've booked for. The nearest train station is very close by and the bus stop only a few steps away. Get an Octupus card from any MTR station if you are staying a few days and plan to use the public transport. It's a shame we didn't get good weather while in HK but am grateful for the recommendations given by porter Leo on what to do on a rainy day. One good place he suggested was outlet shopping (Citygate Outlets) with a big food court at Tung Chung where you can find many international brands at a discount. It's easy access from Tung Chung MTR Station, so we didn't get wet. I'm pleased I chose Nathan Hotel but wish I had known about their hospitality lounge on the 9th floor when I first checked. Overall, good hotel to stay while in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the middle of Kowloon !!”
Reviews.Author: shasha7697
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, walking distance to Jordan MTR and the bus from airport transfer stops in front of the hotel's door step !! You also can take any bus to go anywhere... It is really a good spot or base to travel around Hong Kong even to Macau for a day trip - using their turbojet jetfoil. Awesome !!! Or you can go to Shenzhen, China at the border by hopping to their KCR via MTR. My kids - age 5 - 10 really enjoying their trip to Hong Kong especially to Disneyland ... and they have their own MTR decorated with Disney's characters !!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: james l
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, good location if you want to be in the middle of Kowloon. Just a £20 taxi ride from the airport. Very busy location but its on the main road running through Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Nathan hotel is the best deal in Hong Kong. The hotel is newly renovated, the staff is friendly, we got free buffet breakfast with our room, and it's in a good location. Compared to other hotels, the room is bigger and cleaner. That doesn't mean it's big or that clean (or that modern) but it's perfectly comfortable. We had room for our suitcases and to move around. We were there for 9 nights and didn't feel cramped. The bathroom even had a bathtub, which my four year old liked. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the subway, which isn't bad for HK, and just a 5 minute walk to the Temple Street night market. There are literally hundreds of restaurants in the immediate area and there's a 7-11 next door. Overall, we had a great stay with Nathan and if we go back I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but room not what we booked.”
Reviews.Author: Freedomgirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and liked the hotel, location and staff. This time I booked a Nathan Grand room which their website says are 31-34 sqm (340-370 sqft). I am in a room that is not more than 200 sqft. I called the front desk and they "abruptly" assured me that this is a Nathan Grand room and provided no other explanations. So, either the website or the staff are incorrect. Would have paid less for the Nathan room (220-250 sqft) had I known the Grand rooms were the same size....or they sell Nathan Grand rooms and just slip you into a smaller Nathan room to make more money and hope u don't notice. After reading some other reviews, it looks like this may have happened to others before. **So, a couple days after I posted this review, I felt that I needed to edit it to explain the following: My room was called (on the day of my departure) and the staff asked when my flight was leaving. I told them I had to be at the airport at 3:30 pm and they said "No problem, you can stay in the room as long as you like." When I went down to the lobby to check out and settle my account, I was greeted by the Manager - he said he understood that I had a problem with the room I was provided. He apologized and said if I ever come back, they have flagged my account and want to upgrade me on my next visit - they also provided me with the hotels private shuttle van to the airport (for 2 people) at the same price it would cost me for a taxi. They seemed very sorry and asked if there was anything else they could help us with and seemed to want to make things right. Too bad it was the day we were leaving. Next time I go to Hong Kong I will probably stay at the Nathan and take them up on their offer...wish me luck :) Nathan rooms have access to the 9th floor hospitality room. It's a nice little bonus including 2 computers, fresh ground hot coffee machine, fridge with small juices, T.V., books, and small cookie treats at certain times of the day. They also have a nice wine bar downstairs an indoor/outdoor lounge on the top floor and Starbucks is on the main lobby floor. The buffet breakfast is okay - omelettes or eggs cooked to your liking, breads and pastries, bacon, salads, fruits and cheeses, cereals, juices, tea and coffee and hot dishes such as dim sum, canned pork and beans, oatmeal and fried noodles. Good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: Pangster81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great to explore Hong Kong, great location!! I had my wedding in Hong Kong and chose this hotel, the food for the banquet was beautiful and the restaurant's decor is contemporary - the staff and the food in the restaurant are amazing!!. We stayed in the suite and had lunch (yum cha - traditional chinese lunch) in the hotel restaurant which was excellent... lots of places outside the hotel as its very central - the McDonalds opposite the road is 24 hours which is a bonus as when we were hungry at night we popped over the road and brought the food back to the hotel :) Overall an excellent hotel in Hong Kong - very central, MTR only 5-10 mins walk away and buses right outside the hotel. Public transports in HK is excellent anyway therefore you won't get lost! Only negative comment is that the service at the reception wasn't very good - we waited for a while to check-in and I was in a queue and the receptionists can clearly see I was next however they let a mainlander jumped in the queue rather than telling her to wait which I was a bit annoyed about... by the time I could say something another receptionist took us as she was free by then!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to explore Hong Kong from”
Reviews.Author: NettyRuss
Reviews.Content: We had a three nights stopover at the Nathan. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful and despite being a bit early for official check-in we were allowed into our room. The room was very large and spacious. Bathroom was a good size too with a large shower cubicle. All was beautifully clean and in good order. Nice big towels and free toiletries including toothpaste and mouthwash! Room had a large safe hidden away big enough for a large laptop, there was also free wi-fi with good connective speed. Our room overlooked the side street that you enter the hotel from and despite being on the busy Nathan road we heard no noise. The location of the hotel is ideal, close to the night and Jade markets, and also the MTR station. But a short walk (15mins at a leisurely pace) and you are down at Victoria Harbour. Hotel bar was small but adequate and not as overpriced as most. The one thing that let the hotel down was breakfast. Though adequate buffet breakfast, service was at times chaotic both to get seating and to get coffee, but a minor point. Would definitely stay here again as it had all you need for a short break and easy access to that Hong Kong has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Good staying experience, good service”
Reviews.Author: flywpris
Reviews.Content: We spent one night stay from 02-Apr-2012, they allowed us for early check in without charge & free room upgrade to executive room. The room is so comfortable & large enough with free WIFI service. Easily access to dining & shopping nearby at Nathan Road. Tourist attractions are 1 MTR station away. Hotel staffs are providing good information & with good attitude. FROM: Pris, Apple Flexi Holiday

Reviews.Title: “Decent size rooms, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: steve b
Reviews.Content: For business trip, clean, convenient, good size, everything in good nick, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: PGMAustralia
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Nathan Hotel in HK. Was in HK at the height of the annual Rugby 7's tornament the Nathan like every other hotel in HK up their rates to high season for this event so paid approximately HKD 1800 per night including two breakfasts but was upgraded to an executive room. Easily the biggest room I have ever had in HK and with an active 2 year old accompanying us that was a big plus. My room came with both free Wifi and a free ethernet connection. Breakfasts were up on the 15th floor, nothing special but adequate. Front counter and lobby staff were friendly and efficient, checking in and checking out was finished in minutes As the hotel name would imply it is on Nathan Road, about 200 metres from the Jordan MTR station. Buses running down Nathan Road to the Star Ferry terminal pass by the hotel every minute or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Zorba139
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started here our 3 weeks Thailand trip. We stayed here for 2 nights in mid February. We booked through Agoda and got a good price. The hotel is in a perfect location and very well situated right in the heart of Kowloon on Nathan Road and close to all the tourists markets, shops, restaurants, the MTR rail and walking distance to the harbour and ferry boats. The staff are very friendly and attentive, and there is a very helpful tourist desk. The rooms are clean and well sized. We were on the 8th floor so although the hotel is situated on a main busy road - we didn't hear a thing. Down stairs of the hotel is a 'Starbucks' and a few meters away is a 'SevenEleven'. No problem in getting a taxi outside the hotel (the entrance to the hotel is around the corner from the busy Nathan street which is an advantage. We will no doubt stay here again if ever back in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and affordable”
Reviews.Author: alan j
Reviews.Content: We stopped over on our way to Thailand and our stay at the Nathan turned out to be the most enjoyable part of our two week trip! A very well situated budget hotel right in the heart of Kowloon on Nathan Road and close to all the tourists markets, the MTR rail and walking distance to the harbour and ferry boats. Very attentive staff, helpful tourist desk - clean and well appointed suite and a good breakfast to get your day going. A definite "go back to" !

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous stay at Nathan Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Saimahahmad
Reviews.Content: We ( my 8 yr old girl, hubby & me) just came back fr HK. Stayed 5 nites at Nathan Hotel. It was a wonderful stay. Room size - big enough for us & cleaned well daily. Location - fantastic! Walking distance to MTR station & the shopping paradise of Nathan Road. Bus stop was right infront of the hotel. Service - fantastic!! Staff were always attentive, friendly and helpful. And the best part was this. I celebrated my birthday on our 4th day at HK. Came back from our outing to find a nice birthday card & plate of fruits waiting for me in the room. What a lovely surprise! Nobody told them, so i guess they knew of my birth date from the passport. Will i stay at Nathan Hotel again? YES !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: guptarohan
Reviews.Content: I went to HK in October 2011 with my family. After spending hours & days on the web to find the right Hotel, I finalized on Nathan. To keep the review simple & informative, I will divide it into Pros & cons: Pros: •Location: Very good location that is Nathan road situated in Kowloon, right on the main road •You step down & you have grocery shops, 7-Eleven, McDonald’s, Starbucks, shopping stores. All within 200 metres •Transportation/ Connectivity: Jordan MTR station is within 300-400 metres walk. You can get buses & cabs right outside the hotel •Room: The room was superb, HUGE in size, very clean, modern, had 2 large LCDs about 42 inches, Home theatre system, DVD player, Fridge, really big toilets, very large and comfortable bed, decent view of the main road below •Food: Breakfast buffet spread was amazing with chicken, meat, eggs, veg food, fruits, juice, etc…etc •Service: I din’t expect much of service in HK but to my surprise the staff was very hospitable & quick. It helped me a lot since I have a 1 year old baby. •They have a small study called Nathan Lounge- You can access it with your room keys if you have taken a room with is a superior one. The lounge has 2 PCs with Free internet, reading material & unlimited tea/coffee/ canned juices •Room also offered Free unlimited Wifi •Hotel also provides a tourist map at travel desk which is really helpful to find your way around Cons: •Prices are a bit steep, but it is worth it. I paid around 2500 HK dollars per day inclusive of breakfast for 2. •Wifi keeps getting logged out and you have to repeatedly login •Staff doesn’t understand English very very well, it is average. Maybe because of accent difference! •Check in time is 3pm and check out 12 pm… but I think that is standard all over HK •The services offered like wifi, breakfast, Lounge access differ with room category so one has to be careful and clarify beforehand

Reviews.Title: “Service needs to improve!”
Reviews.Author: Jane5432
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nathan hotel from the 4th to the 8th February 2012. The location was probably a little too far from the Star Ferry end of Kowloon for my liking. The room was a small neat and clean compact area with a small well appointed bathroom, shower only ,no bath - a plus in my book. I loathe stepping in and out of slippery baths to have a shower ! The TV was a good sized flat screen attached to the wall - good choice of cable channels as well. Breakfast which was included was a whole different experience! The staff barely speak English, no one was there at the entrance to the room to meet you and seat you. By the way the breakfast room is located on the 14 th floor and then you must walk the next 2 flights of stairs to reach it. This may be difficult for people with a disability or the elderly. The buffet breakfast did not offer a great selection. The chef who was meant to be cooking at the egg station was never present so I asked a waitress if I could order an egg and she looked at me like I asked her to offer up her newborn son to sacrifice! A very sullen face! She then personally cooked me an omelette which was basically raw and pushed the plate at me and walked off. The service was no better the next 2days. The staff on front desk were okay if you happened to speak to someone who could speak English and also there was one girl on the desk who constantly wore a surgical mask so you couldn't understand her muffled voice. Maybe she didn't realize the SARS scare ended years ago in Hong Kong. The Concierge was a fantastic help and spoke brilliant English- he's wasted in such a mediocre hotel. Won't stay there again as the staff need to learn to smile and be pleasant to their clientele! I was a single female traveling on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.m”
Reviews.Author: Lacrimalake
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nathan hotel as I had matters to attend to at Queen Elizabeth Hospital. I paid 210 Singapore dollars a night for a standard room. Pros were 1. Great location. It was 5 minutes away from Jordan MTR and right smack in the middthe buzz of Kowloon. From the airport, one can take a taxi for 250 HKD or hop onto the airport express for 90 HKD bearing in mind the 2 transfers required. 2. Cleanliness. I have no complaints with regards to that. The housekeeping staff was very meticulous in tidying up the rooms. 3. Free wifi with dedicated bandwidth. Enough said. Cons were 1. Dreary view. But it's old town town Kowloon with sky scrapers all around so I wasn't expecting much to begin with. 2. Mediocre breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to travelers looking for a fuss free short stay in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lifejourneys
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Jordon MTR station and eateries. Entrance is not directly on Nathan Road but easy to find. Booking via hotel search engines is much cheaper than booking directly. Standard room size just adequate but if you need a queen sized bed, wont get an upgrade to deluxe which is more spacious. Very cute tiny bath tub and toiletries refilled everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyStans
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. Room was very spacious and well designed as was the bathroom (no bath, shower only). Easy stroll to the Temple Street night market, jade market and a slightly longer walk or short train ride to the harbour. Staff are extremely welcoming and helpful. Reception area is not particularly grand, so I was a little apprehensive when we arrived about what the standard of the rooms would be. We were pleasantly surprised! Cellar bar was very pleasant (great cheese platter!). Restaurant upstairs was a little disappointing and lacking in ambiance - you're better off trying one of the amazing restaurants at Sky 101 in the ICC building. Or for a more down-to-earth experience, one of the little restaurants off Temple Street market. There are tons of them, so it can be a bit "hit or miss". In summary, we have no hesitation recommending the Nathan for a comfortable and sensibly priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Went with the bad reviews from tripadvisor in my mind and was glad I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: cassiemcvey
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews from Nathan Hotel and decided to go with it even though there was a bad review or two. From what I remember they said the staff were rude and the rooms smelt like smoke - two of my pet hates when it comes to hotel stays, however, the staff were spot on. We did have an issue at one point on our 2nd night where we smelt cigarette smoke,so we called the reception and let them know. They sent someone up to investigate straight away, called us back within 5 minutes and although they cldnt find the smoker, they gave a solution of either airfreshner or transfer to another room. The smell had gone by then, must have been a small waft from the a/c or something, so we stayed put. Still, very impressed with their assertiveness. Location is great, it took about 15 mins to walk to the ladies Market, 5 mins to temple st, 3 mins to the next MRT station, 10 mins to langham place - perfect spot. Oh, another complaint I previously read was that the breakfast was no good - this is not true either, they have a decent selection, it's not huge, but more than enough for a good start to your day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location- Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: ozJOHNau
Reviews.Content: Went here on the 6th Feb till 14th Feb 2012. The location is great. Hotel is just great and the staff where friendly. I stayed with my dad and its close to the MTR ,Bus . In fact everything Would I stay Again. YES!!

Reviews.Title: “Polite and friendly staff, excellent location, free wifi.”
Reviews.Author: buff-boy888
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful, the location of the hotel was very good with MTR stations very close by, I would recommend this hotel to anybody. The wifi is free and it has a Starbucks on the ground floor if you're into the Starbucks hype. The gym is very small but adequate for maintaining fitness (who works out that much on holiday anyway!).

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Noelia187448
Reviews.Content: Staff always available and very kind. Breakfast is very good and with a lot of variety. The rooms are spacious and clean. There is also a very cosy bar at the top where you can have a beer. The hotel location is perfect if you want to be in the middle of the ladies market, Temple and Jade market, Nathan Rd is also full of shops. Not so far from the Star ferries or the Avenue of stars. I would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/reasonable prices/free wifi”
Reviews.Author: ravi k
Reviews.Content: On my most recent visit to Hong Kong we stayed at this centrally located hotel. The staff were extremely courteous, the rooms spacious and the wifi free and fast! The prices were reasonable. There are plenty of eating places in the vicinity and the metro within easy reach. We booked this hotel at the airport through the Hong Kong Hotel Association. It is close to the touristic Tsim sha Tsui area. We will stay there again and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Hiro_Jen
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Nathan Hotel for 2 nights to kick-start our honeymoon in Asia. We had booked the Nathan Suite with a balcony and it was the perfect room for us - spacious, bright, and is ideally located on Nathan Road. There's so much happening around us and it was great to come back to a hotel where you're constantly greeted and room was always made up. Customer service was excellent. We would definitely stay here again if we return to HK in the future. Breakfast buffet was terrific and plentiful. We always looked forward to starting our day with their breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay in Hong Kong!!!”
Reviews.Author: billyboy9501
Reviews.Content: Yet another great stay in Hong Kong!!! My wife and I have just spent 10 days / 9 nights in this beautiful city staying at The Nathan Hotel for our forth time. Once again we found the standard of rooms and staff to be that of the highest standard. Remembering The Nathan Hotel is a Four Star hotel offering Five Star service. Concierge Ariel went out of his way to assist us from arranging our return airport transfers to an amazing restaurant where we were able to watch the amazing CNY Fireworks Display. The Front Office staff and Manager Mr Chui were always there to assist us in all of our needs. Rooms were very clean and tidy and of an excellent size by Hong Kong standards. The hotel is only a few minutes away from the Jordan MTR Station, which gives you access to all parts of Hong Kong. Temple Street Night Markets are two blocks away and the number of local eating places close by are a treat for those keen on trying the Local foods, which we did and loved. The Nathan Hotel is a great base for all your sightseeing needs and there is a Local Tour Desk in the Reception area where the friendly young lady who speaks very good English will be more than happy to give you advise and make bookings for you. We enjoyed our visit at The Nathan so much again that we have already started our planning for our 2013 visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricko1444
Reviews.Content: You could not get a better room 2 living area,s and very big rooms and right in middle of every thing

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all”
Reviews.Author: traveller225
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4 night stay its a very good mid range hotel. None of the problems people have listed in the past applied to my stay. The staff were great Nathan floor is updated and as good as any in this price range. My only slight down side was the meal I had in my room. Not too good. But there are loads of places to eat around about and the breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Falsely accused of using mini bar”
Reviews.Author: PuristDriver
Reviews.Content: The location of Nathan hotel is hard to beat being near Temple street in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei. The rooms themselves are average at best, but the price is pretty good. It was quite convenient to get to Mong Kok and Tsim Tsa Tsui either by walking or MTR (station is two blocks away). As for service, we had two very polarizing experiences with the front desk. The first time we checked in, they upgraded us free of charge to a bigger room and the front desk was very friendly. However, on the day we checked out, we were accused of consuming a drink from the mini bar. We travel a lot and never use the mini bar since it's a rip-off. It was a drink that I purchased at the 7-11 a block away. As a result, it was hugely disappointing to be accused of something I didn't do and it really soured our overall experience at the hotel which was bordering on 4 stars given the free upgrade, great location, and value. The front desk lady handled the situation very poorly while making accusations without much proof besides an empty bottle found in the garbage can. Our previous stay at the hotel the week before revealed a fridge without the drink in question so I don't know if they're sure that drink is at every room. A bad experience over a $2 drink is highly unfortunate, but that's what happened. The rest of the staff was great especially the person that checked us in (absolutely professional and helpful), the doorman and baggage check-in who was used on a few occasions. Other pros: Their gym is excellent for the price point. There are 4 cardio machines, a bunching bag/stand, a few benches, free weights, shower and bathrooms, and a self service ipad that plays music for the room. Before the incident, there was no doubt I would consider Nathan again on my next trip, but I am not so certain anymore and would definitely consider other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chriiss
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in early January 2012. Location is right on Nathan Road but a good 20-25 mins walk from Star Ferry but 1, 1A and 7 buses run frequently and cost around HK$5 Staff were excellent and we were upgraded to a suite FOC. WiFi is free and fast. Restaurant on the top floor was interesting and food good. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: VolosTina
Reviews.Content: Is located on nathan road, nearby night market many eateries around, good value for money. The rooms need a bit of renovation, very small public area in the lobby, average quality of breakfast. Overall a good solution for city visitors.

Reviews.Title: “family christmas vacation in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: fourhearts2e4k
Reviews.Content: my family had a nice stay at the hotel, receptionist at the front desk are friendly and accommodating. shopping stalls and transits are all a few minutes walk away. night markets at temples st. and jade market are just a block away where you can get a lot of bargains. will be glad to be back at the hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: iris423
Reviews.Content: My family and I ended up spending 6 nights here because we had a problem with our flight out of Hong Kong. The hotel staff was kind enough to let us come back to the same room on minimal notice. We were very impressed by the nearly instantaneous response to any request we made. The breakfast was very good, with some different offerings each morning and very attentive wait staff. The gym was small but remarkably well equipped. The location was very convenient to anywhere in Kowloon and to the Jordan MTR to Hong Kong and beyond. The only negative aspect of our experience was that the room and accoutrements were almost literally a little frayed around the edges. The carpet was worn and had at least one stain. The towels and bathrobes were sometimes slightly frayed.We had a new, flat screen TV, but the furniture seemed a little old. I would definitely come back here. With luck, they will have updated their carpet and towels by the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: summerwow10
Reviews.Content: Was in HK for 5days4nights. Arrived early in am, rooms were not ready till after 12 noon. Wecwaited at the lobby as nothing was open that early in the day in HK. Staff were nice to keep checking if room were ready. In the end we got our room at 1030 am, and a free upgrade to a large family room. Breakfast was included and have a good range of options to choose from. Room was clean and promptly tidied up everyday. located in Jordan and only 3-4 streets away from MTR so v convenient. there's a Starbucks and 7-11 downstairs hence late night snack was no problem at all. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: makeupaddict
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel about a month before my trip and at the time, it was the best in terms of price and location. I needed 2 rooms and preferably with free internet. The Nathan Hotel was the best choice. But I had my doubts having read the reviews here. To my surprise, the executive twin rooms that I got were very large, clean and newly-renovated. I was given the non-smoking rooms. I also got my requested connecting rooms so my family could be together but at the same time my daughter and I had some privacy as my teenage son shared the other room with my husband. In terms of location, the hotel is not at the heart of TST as it is actually in the Jordan area midway between TST and Mongkok. The better shops and restaurants are in the TST area. The markets, except for Temple Street, are in Mongkok. Having said that, it is definitely less crowded here and getting to anywhere is very convenient. The bus stops are just outside and the train station is just a short walk away. It was difficult trying to decide where to stay in HK. The HK side is probably better in terms of attractions and shopping. But the Kowloon side has more local life and I found it more interesting. All in all, if you decide to stay in the Kowloon side, the Nathan Hotel would be a good choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CatloverNewZealand
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel that is very central to all you want. Markets are close by and the subway is 2 blocks away and so easy to negotiate. The staff at the hotel are excellent, helpful and friendly. We also used the tourist desk which was excellent. The staff there gave us maps and suggested interesting tours. The breakfasts were yummy and the facilities overall excellent. I would certainly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “BOOKING WITH LAST MINUTE .COM”
Reviews.Author: TONY K
Reviews.Content: Booked Nathan Hotel with last minute .com they were offering executive room for £608 for five nights in November I asked for a non smoking double, what did I get a smoking room executive twin on the smoking 14th floor the place was terrible if you are not a smoker I ask to be moved they said they could not do it till the next day,when they moved us it was a nathan room, not .an executive room,when you book with last minute make sure you get what you ask for the staff at nathan are very polite,hotel in good position for temple st would not stay there again also if fly with Swiss air through zrh do not do it the aircraft is too small a340-400 seating is terrible 12hr flight not easy to get up and walk about tony

Reviews.Title: “good location, doubtful cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: maillart
Reviews.Content: Nicely located, I mean geographically - badly located if you look for some better quality of air - the Nathan Road is one of the most badly polluted spots in Hong Kong. The staff was correct, only passable. Our room (14th floor) was, unfortunately for us, a smoking one - the smell of cigarettes stayed on our clothes. The window was closed permanently and the air conditioning filter's quality seemed dubious. We preferred not to walk bare feet on the carpet - very old and its color not identified. Found some hair in the bathroom, the bathroom that really needed some renovation - we remarked some renovation work in progress on other levels, I guess our level was only next on the list.. However, considering the hotel prices in Hong Kong, we found that the Nathan Hotel represented an interesting value.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Nathan Supporter”
Reviews.Author: nathansupporter
Reviews.Content: Returned again after our enjoyable stay last year. (Check "Nathan Supporter" review November 2010) Still many of the same familiar and smiling faces including Leo Leung, now considered our friend, who again looked after us extremely well. Had a Nathan Grand room again and enjoyed the privileges which go with it. Buffet breakfast is top class and difficult to imagine any one not finding something to their liking and sufficient to fuel up for the day ahead. General amenities of the hotel are very good and although perhaps not the glitz and glamour of some of the harbourside hotels it is not lacking in either service or facilities. Will be my choice of stay for any future trips to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moontart
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It was close to the MTR station and also had the Temple street shopping in walkable distance. We were not confined to our hotel but could walk out at night and just hang out, shop and eat- which is exactly what we did. The hotel also had a lovely rooftop bar, Balis that was so relaxing to just drink and chill that I literally fell alsleep there one night. We had a standard and suite room for our party of 5. The standard room was a bit old but had everything we needed, such as a clean comfortable beds, adequate light, flat screen tv and working bathrooms- the only thing I would warn is that the hairdryers had about the strength of a breath- literally! But other than that it was fine, it was hot weather in HK that we didn't need the hairdryer- lol. The suite room - it was obviously updated and very modern- just a warning, the door to the bathroom was a sliding door that had a thick glass - you couldn't see anything but thought some might want to know. I personally prefer a good old wooden doors when traveling with friends and in laws- as we were. The suite also made available their lounge which had free espressos( awesome!), internet (all rooms had free wifi), tea and sitting area. the lounge area would only fit about 5 people at a time but it was very nice and modern and they really tried to use all of the small space available. The service of this hotel was outstanding- the maids , bell boys and customer service was excellent- very attentive and detailed. If you want a nice place to sleep and chill and be in the center of Hong Kong this hotel is it. On the same block of the hotel was a foreign currency exchange store, 7eleven, and late night restaurants. If you cross the blvd from the hotel (which I would recommend) you really experience the old Hong Kong with the morning bustle and hustle and nighttime shopping and eatery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hospitality and Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: vivacircus30
Reviews.Content: Checked in here in September 2011 and the superior rooms (Standard ones). LOCATION: Its location in Jordon, was kind of smack between Jordon MTR and Yau Ma Tei MTR, it takes about 8-10mins to walk to Jordon MTR. You can actually hop onto one of the many buses that head either to Tsim Sha Tsui or Mongkok if you want to save on walking and its quick! Starbucks downstairs for a quick coffee, across the road we have late night street food at temple street or McDonald's if you feel like it. Walk a little bit more you get some of the best food places such as KAM WAH and AUSTRALIAN DAIRY. For me its fantastic!! Of course it is not as close to the main shopping areas...The room and service balance that out. ROOMS: Rooms were refurbished recently, very clean big rooms! Size is great for Hong Kong standard. An area to put your luggage, a sitting area and you get views of the densely populated buildings. A nice LCD TV to relax, what more can you ask for? SERVICE: The service was great. Friendly staff that helped provided us with helpful tips on where to go and was always ready with a big friendly smile when we enter or exit the hotel. Was a great was to start and end the day. The hotel staff also helped us to book a cab with a very good price when we had to go to the airport, I was very very impressed. Great initiative. Had a great time there! =)

Reviews.Title: “Mostly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelSydney
Reviews.Content: We are generally very easily pleased but the Nathan Hotel was a disappointment. We stayed there for 6 nights in October. The reception area is new and small and the hotel has two lifts which can be slow during peak times. While our room was large enough it had “had its day” and was now looking tired and in need of major renovation. The carpet was old and needed replacing. The walls and ceiling, some of which had been water affected, needed a good paint and the bathroom was small, outdated and mouldy. I guess it was the sort of mould that comes over time and that which they couldn’t get rid of. The staff were helpful and attentive and when we explained that we weren’t happy with the quality of the room they held another room for us to inspect upon our return from sightseeing the second day. While the alternative room’s bathroom was a lot newer and nicer, on the whole the room was smaller and just the same so we decided to stay in the first room. I also must comment that I received good responses to email from the property’s staff prior to arrival. I had booked on line and on that particular website you couldn’t request a non-smoking room option. So I emailed the hotel directly to request this and was assured that we would get a non-smoking room, which was the case. The location of the hotel is reasonable in the Jordan area with a bus stop right at the front door which takes you to the Star Ferry. The nearest MTR train station was 2 blocks away and the Temple Street Night Markets are right at your door. However, we found the restaurants and shopping better in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms (at least the one we had) is in major need of renovation and we prefer the Tsim Sha Tsui area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: fionaLittlehampton
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here and it is well situated. I would recommend the brerakfasts too!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaskaSlovenia
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on good location, from Airport I recommended BUS A 21 (one way 3,30 €/September 2011) because bus stop is near hotel and trip from Airport to the Hotel on second floor of bus is so good you see much more then with MTR.. I booked exclusive room for 2 nights it was not so cheap but for location that you get I didn’t complained to long. Room was clean, big, free water, tea, coffe, internet… Locations is good for shopping and discover the City of Hong Kong.. Stall is always there to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, quiet, good location, exceptional service. We were pleasantly impressed with the Nathan Hotel. We had a very large room (by Hong Kong standards) and there was enough space for our four suitcases, two bags and numerous other bits and pieces. There was also a desk and armchair, and there was free Wifi - which was fast! Our room was lovely, the bed was hard (as was expected), the air conditioning worked really well, the double glazing kept out the street noise, and we had no noise from other hotel guests. The bathroom was quite small, but perfectly adequate, and there was a good amount of bench space to keep toiletries on. The staff were extremely helpful and polite, and they helped with queries/ordering taxis. Also, when I booked I asked for a quiet room with enough space for six bags. I don't know if this influenced the room I was given, but it was a good size and it was a corner room away from the lifts, so it was very quiet. Pros: large western-style hotel room, air con, double glazed, desk to use computer at, good location in the heart of Kowloon, extremely helpful staff, room safe. Cons: large, hard pillows - and they had no thin ones to exchange. The lifts take ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Exceptional Service - Nathan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawt
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised that the staff at Nathan Hotel were very helpful and generous with their time. Internet was cheap (and they were kind enough to print our documents for free!). Location-wise, because it was in Kowloon, and not Hong Kong Island, we found ourselves commuting A LOT - but that was part of the fun! The rooms were clean, and not extremely modern, but comfortable and definitely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shaowei
Reviews.Content: Fun location for tourists, free wifi and bathtub, helpful concierge for about $150 US.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the thick of it”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights (Sept 2011) and loved it. Great modern clean hotel right on Nathan Road; a block from Temple Street markets. Highly recommended, staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: RubenTal
Reviews.Content: Far from TST area, 10 min walking from any MTR station. No business Center in Hotel, I gave up my free breakfast to upgrade to a decent room. Original room was old, stinky, bad a/c and rusted shower. "Upgraded" room was OK, but wifi internet was a challenge, must go on hallway to get signal. Next time will pay few box extra to get to e better Hotel. BTW this is NOT 4 stars Hotel. In USA it will be barely a 3 stars. Dont get fulled by the pics.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan i still my choice hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Traveleddict
Reviews.Content: Nathan Hotel is my choice hotel in Hong Kong, the location is good. Eateries are within steps away. The rooms are well designed and clean, the bed is big and comfortable. They even provide a menu for pillows. For coffee lovers, there's a starbucks right beside the lobby floor. Top floor restaurant provides reasonable breakfast and there is a recreation room on the executive floor for guest to use with internet ready computer, magizines, coffee, juice and nice sofa. The staffs are very friendly and helpful, house keeping are dedicated and resourceful as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Winner”
Reviews.Author: BrizvegasMatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of 10 friends in August. The hotel is in a great location one block from the Temple St markets, and maybe a 5 minute walk from the Jordan MTR station. The rooms represent good value and are a great size for Hong Kong. I'd recommend upgrading to the better rooms as the finishes are nicer and represent better value again - certainly better than the 3.5 stars advertised. The restaurant was good for breakfast and cheap at around $8 AUD per person. Most of all, the staff were excellent, particularly Lillian in the reservation area who made sure that our 4 rooms were made up as we requested them. The service was always spot on, and the team were really helpful in ordering cabs, helping with directions etc. I'd definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Liz H
Reviews.Content: The first room we were provided was a Nathan room and was quite small. We asked for an upgrade to a Nathan Grand room and this was way bigger, definitely worth paying the extra. Rooms were modern and clean and hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The best thing about this hotel was the location. Sat directly on Nathan Road with a bus stop right outside the hotel to travel down Nathan road and drop off to either shop or stop off at the Ferry pier. A few hundred metres across the road was the night market, great location to get dinner after a long day sight seeing and then to be able to drop into Starbucks directly under the hotel for a chilled frappacino before hitting the sack. Only negative is that there is no pool, however reasonably priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Himalayer
Reviews.Content: Good location , Easy access to Metro, Would stay again. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_lin294217
Reviews.Content: I had 3 nights and 4 days at this Hotel. It is very well located being right in the centre of Kowloon and only a 5 minute walk from the MTR, from which you can travel all over Hong Kong. It is also walking distance to the Harbour Ferry if you want a pleasant stroll. I stayed in a standard room which had good internet access, good lighting, a very comfortable bed and pillows, a large bathroom and everything I needed as a solo traveller (including plug adaptor!). I used the coach service to travel between the hotel and airport (I booked this through the hotel's own booking site). It was HKD130 and very convenient. Getting the airport express train requires getting to an airport express train station, then getting on and I think the cost may work out the same as getting on the coach at the hotel/airport and going to the door of the airport/hotel. Breakfast was straightforward and good value. I didn't have a lot of dealings with hotel staff, but when I did, they were very pleasant and helpful - and the things they arranged went without a hitch. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: orangeaurora
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I found the Nathan Hotel. I was looking for something on the Kowloon side that was clean and comfortable, close to the MTR, and reasonably priced. This was it. It's a very quick walk from Jordan stop, so it was easy for us to get anywhere we needed to go. The room was tastefully decorated in modern decor. The bed was comfortable. There was a small fridge and each day our room was replenished with two small bottles of complimentary water. I am a light sleeper and worry about noise, but we didn't get much noise at all from other rooms or the hallway. Breakfast was good with a variety of Asian and Western choices, including an omlette station. It was the same every day, but I still looked forward to it. Our interactions with the staff were positive. The only downside was that for whatever reason, we couldn't connect to the free wifi from our room. There are two computer stations off the lobby downstairs though, so we were not entirely Internet deprived. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melvinlhm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 13-17 July with 2 family members. The room size was spacious in comparison to the typical shoe-sized hotel rooms I've stayed in previous times. To fit 3 of us, they added an additional bed (for a charge of course). The rooms start from level 7 and the penthouse rooms are on level 14/15. The service at this hotel is good and whenever we had problems, the staff on duty will always put in their best effort to resolve it. Located next to the hotel are some local restaurants that serve great food. The Cheers restaurant serves dim sum and many locals frequent this for their breakfast fix, so you know this place is not a food joint with marked up prices for tourists. Also nearby is a Tsui Wah cafe that offers reasonably priced food. Going to the MTR is a little far away as you'll have to cross about 4 streets to get to the nearest exit to Jordan MTR. Other than that, the location of this hotel is great. This hotel offers free WiFi, so that's great if you wish to stay connected with your friends and family back home.

Reviews.Title: “Good medium priced hotel located in the centre of Kowloon shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Eddie015
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Nathan Room which gave free Wi-Fi and breakfast, plus use of a very small Nathan lounge facility with 2 connected PC's, a TV and beverages. The main drawback to this hotel was the lack of a pool - so nowhere really to sit in the sun and relax with a beer. Also the rooms were showing a bit of wear and tear, but were excellently cleaned throughout our stay. All staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly with organised tours. We bought an Octopus Travel Card which covered bus, ferry and the MTR - all efficient, clean and cheap to travel on. Using the ferry to HK Island also had the bonus of a short harbour tour! If you like genuine Chinese food do not miss CHEERS restaurant adjacent to the hotel - great food at unbelievable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was pretty decent Hotel, one can go and stay”
Reviews.Author: RahulPrakashMishra
Reviews.Content: Service was very good. Room was neat and clean and was value for money. Location and amenities was ok, i am saying ok because it was neither close to airport not to business center where i had to go, and even to take a metro u have to walk at least 1 km. it was a good experience. For Vegetarian's like me it was horrible w,r.t food

Reviews.Title: “Rude management”
Reviews.Author: yum88
Reviews.Content: Great location but poor management ruined it. We payed for an executive sweet but we were placed in a regular nathan one. When we brought it up to management we were given attitude like we were causing trouble and we somehow made the mistake. We were finally given the correct room just to find we were assigned to room "1414" which if you are Chinese you know it's bad luck. We didn't look like locals but westerners, how they would treat people who are not from the area is horrible. We spoke to the bellboy about our unhappiness regarding the "1414" and our situation and he said he would have been upset and not want that number as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, service depends on reception stuff”
Reviews.Author: Svestka
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location, breakfast you will most likely take in Starbucks which is located directly in the hotel (hard to say what is cheaper).
