Rooms were reasonble big and compare prices in HK ok. Unforunately service level depends a lot on guy who is currently at reception. Once we had luck, once bad luck difference is huge. Also its little bit strange that hotel really likes to block deposites for quite some time, so if you stay there longer it can be problem (since they block little bit more then your spend).

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: HOTELUNO
Reviews.Content: Nathan Hotel is on a good location, not far from subway, only 5 minutes walk. The lobby is nice and probably has just been refurbished. However, the room is just ok. It's a bit old and need to have a revamp. Hotel provides good variety of breakfast, offers Free WiFi and staffs are friendly. Overall make our business trip a pleasant stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to the Nathan Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FraiseFraise
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-night stay at the Nathan Hotel and I have nothing but praise for the establishment. Transport-wise, it is an easy 1-hour ride via the CityFlyer bus A21 from the airport (HK$33 per person, but either check with the bus driver where to alight or watch out for the cross streets near hotel), or you can always choose the more expensive option of taking the Airport Express train and transiting to the complimentary shuttle which drops you off at the Eathan Hotel next door (We did not choose this option so am unable to comment on this experience). The Nathan Hotel is also located less than 5 minutes’ walk away from the Jordan MTR station, so getting anywhere in HK by public transport is a breeze. The hotel is also just across the road from the Temple Street Night Market where many small restaurants are located. However, if you are, like us, more interested in visiting the much livelier Ladies Market area in Mongkok, it is about a 25 minutes’ walk or so from the hotel (or 2 MTR stations away from Jordan). We had booked a Nathan Room and were given a corner unit just a couple of doors away from the Nathan Lounge. As such, we popped over to the Nathan Lounge quite frequently for the yummy canned juices, pastries and espresso. There is a variety of reading material in the lounge as well as two computer terminals for use. Besides the use of the lounge, another privilege of booking a Nathan Room was the free daily breakfast. Although not particularly spectacular, the breakfast spread was decent and the dishes do get updated daily. The hotel room itself was cozy and well-furnished. Sound-proofing was good and street-noise was non-existent even though we were directly overlooking the busy Nathan Road. The bathroom though, was a tad small. The shower stall was however very well constructed and no water seepage to the outside sink area occurred no matter how merrily I splashed about in the shower. ;) There was also more than sufficient shelf space in the shower stall for toiletries. All in all, it was an extremely good stay and I will not hesitate recommending the hotel to anyone. Besides the points mentioned above, the staff of the Nathan Hotel are also amongst the most polite I have encountered in HK hotels. Staff members will often rush to open the lobby glass doors for you with a smile. We will definitely be returning to the Nathan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and huge flaat screen tv”
Reviews.Author: Jacaranda06
Reviews.Content: Next to Nathan road, closed to the Mong kok and temple street market is a 5 stars quality hotel. Big and clean rooms with all amenities don't bring the toothbrush they provide it! free High speed internet and wide flat screen tv , my husband was astonished! Brekfast is fantastic you love Asian, European, American or Japanese here's your choise. Located in a very good positin is a great starting point to visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ap200
Reviews.Content: Party of three people. We stayed in an Executive Grand room with an extra bed. It was a comfortable stay. Rooms are of a good quality and well maintained/cleaned. Complimentary items such as slippers are a nice touch for a four-star hotel. Location is decent. About 10-15 min walk to the harbour (or faster by bus/taxi). Night market is also close by. There is a starbucks attached to the lobby which is quite convenient. We took airport express and got off at Jordan. From there it is about a 10 min walk down Nathan Road to the hotel (look for the Starbucks as the entrance to the hotel is not on Nathan Road). On the way back we took a taxi which was slightly more expensive (with three people) but faster and more convenient. Overall a good, comfortable, and quiet stay. Free high speed internet was definitely convenient. However, on the next trip we would likely stay in Central as we found that we spent most of our time there. But that said, this location was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Rachie11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, close to markets, malls & harbour. Would suggest to book a Nathan room - upgraded floors & includes breakfast, internet & use of the nathan club loung. Breakfast was great, good selection of eastern & western foods. Was upgraded to a suite which was very spacious but was not an upgraded room - was not as nice as we were expecting. Have booked again for November

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: picklejuzz
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a breeze and staff was attentive.Just 5 minute walk to the MTR.The Hotel is very strategically located.Breakfast is alright if you're not fussy (they still serve bacon&egg).Will def.check in again.Make sure u stay on the Nathan floor as they offer you free Internet and a self-service lounge which serve coffee,tea,juice&biscuits.Beside the Hotel is Starbucks & 7-Eleven :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: pavan208
Reviews.Content: I was staying this hotel in electronic Fair time in Hong Kong . Hotel is well as other four star hotels. Staff is helping and always try resolve your issue.Reception also helpful in guiding you for the visiting place. Indian restaurants are around 2 KM far from this hotel. Metro is near by.Good location

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location Get This One Across The Line!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMuratore
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Hong Kong now on several occasions as it is my favorite destination by far. The cities neon lights, excellent choice of eateries and an awesome array of shopping malls. I stayed at the Eaton Hotel on my first trip to Hong Kong and noticed the Nathan Hotel directly across the road and was impressed by the outside facade. We booked a rather large room with breakfast each morning. The room was a triangular shaped and was a little suffocating at times however the room was still very nice none the less. The morning however brought noise and annoyances from 7:00am which drove me absolutely crazy. We also experienced quite a lot of attitude from the breakfast staff which was very unusual. I had asked the waiter for some cutterly as the items that I was given were dirty. The waited proceeded to throw the cutterly on the table in a rude manner. I then decided to speak to the hotel management about the noise and the abrupt behavior. The hotel manager very quickly apologized to us and offered us a Nathan Hotel Suite which was around the size of a small apartment which contained two large LCD television screens and a huge bathroom. The hotel staff were very keen to assist us and were very apologetic in trying to appease our concerns. The breakfast was very good, there was an assortment of all cuisines catering to different backgrounds. The location is excellent very central to Nathan Road and Hong Kong Island itself. The only downside to this hotel is that it has no pool and the views from each room are below par, however the roof top bar and the rather large rooms more than compensate for these negative points. The free internet is also a bonus as most internet through out Hong Kong hotels is quite slow. The cleaners are also excellent and very good at their job, the rooms were spotless. I would recommend the Nathan Hotel but based on service and location only.

Reviews.Title: “Real value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrsK96
Reviews.Content: Having heard that room are small in Hong Kong Hotels, I picked this hotel due to the generous room size. However I got more than I bargained for. The free internet in the room and nathan lounge was a plus factor. The hotel is stylish and upmarket. Concierge was very helpful. Check in and check out was a breeze. Breakfast was average. I would certainly go back as I love the space!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great hotel - not so great location”
Reviews.Author: paddling_kiki
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rather far removed from all the main sights in Hong Kong. We had booked because we were under the impression that it was closer to where we wanted to be. Note to self - scales used on city maps for hotel websites often are misleading. The hotel itself was rather dirty, the air conditioning didn't work, the beds weren't very comfortable, and we all ended up sick after staying in the hotel. We believe that there may have been some recycled air issues throughout the hotel. Other than the fact that the hotel was close to the night market on Temple street, I wouldn't recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: vinpin
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very helpful and pleasant to deal with. The hotel location was great as it was near the Temple Street Night Market and easy transit. They upgraded us to a suite and brought in an extra bed for our teenage son. It was big enough for the three of us, but just barely. The rooms were clean and neat but was slightly musty smelling. The breakfasts were great as there was lots to choose from even for picky eaters.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with hotel. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: teasixfan
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars, but how accommodating the staff was bumped it up to 5 for me. My husband and I booked a Nathan Room for 3 nights in March 2011 based on TA reviews and we were very impressed with the hotel. Our room was at the end of the hall on Floor 12 and it was a pretty decent size for a HK hotel. We only shared one wall with the neighbors and it's nice that the walls are thick and we didn't hear them at all. The decoration was chic and modern, and the huge 65in flat screen TV was a nice touch. The bedding was just as soft as the sheets I use at home, and I use 400-450 thread count. The bed was a little too hard for me, but the husband slept just fine. You could also order different kinds of pillows for your stay. The bathroom was small (shower only, no tub) but very well-designed and had all the amenities you could ever want. The robes and slippers they provided were very comfortable. The gym is located on the 6th floor and only has 4 machines and some free weights. However, there's a punching bag and gloves that the husband was very happy with. The massage chair costs 5 HKD for 15 minute and since we didn't have exact change, we didn't try it. The Nathan lounge is located on the 9th floor and it's quite small. It's really only consisted of 3 small areas, one with 2 computers, one with a comfy chair, and another section where the drinks are and some chairs. They have a coffee/espresso machine, tea, some cookies, and 3 types of canned juice (pineapple, grapefruit and I think apple). There's a note on the juice bar that asks you not to take the juice out of the Nathan Lounge, and that if you do, you will be charged 10 HKD for each can. There's no bottle water, but you can get hot water from the coffee machine. Breakfast at the 15th floor could use some work. The eggs chef is pretty good and can make you omelets or any eggs to your order, but the rest of the selection is pretty weak. I would only eat breakfast there if it came with the room. Location is fantastic. We took the A21 bus from the airport (33 HKD one way, or 55 HKD round trip), and we were dropped off half a block away from the hotel. The Jordan MTR is 4 blocks away and about a 5 minute walk, and Temple Street Market is pretty much across the street (I can see it from our room). There are various buses either half a block or 1.5 blocks down Nathan Road: 2, 6, 6A take you to Star Ferry, and 35, 41 take you to the History Museum. Check out the routes before heading out to avoid confusion: http://www.kmb.hk/en/ and http://www.nwstbus.com.hk/home/ Check in/check out was fast. We wanted to use the fridge to store our own drinks so we asked them to clear out the mini bar. Both elevators were working during our stay but the system isn't the smartest. I can see the wait being long if one of them was down. We tried using the stairs, but it was dark and seemed to be only used for emergencies. The blinking lights in the elevator were annoying. The wireless internet did not work during our stay and we had to use the ethernet cable. It was down briefly but after a call to the front desk, they fixed it in 40 minutes. We had a late flight and the hotel accommodated our request for a late check out. They also held our bags after check out, and when we came back at 8pm, they gave us the gym key so that we could use the shower and repack. That was very nice. It's these little things that made our stay truly enjoyable. We will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to MRT and markets”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel88888888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice the first time for 6 nights then second time for 2 nights. The staff were fantastic nothing was two much trouble we letf most of our stuff there in between trips wityh no problems they even kept some flowers and watered them i had brought for my daughters birthday. We were out at Disneyland all day for her birthday but when we got home there was a small gift and card on the bed foe her she was so chuffed. Really close to temple street night market could see if from my room and a little ferther down the road was tjhe Jade market. Fantastic Hotel. Would stay there again. Room was huge.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: superawesome
Reviews.Content: outstanding location. walking distance to Jordan MTR, Temple night market. Close to Airport bus stop (just cross the street and walk a few meters). no breakfast served but they give McDonald's breakfast coupons for 2 persons per day. McDonald's is right across the street. Our room had 2 single beds, TV with English channels (BBC, CNN, NatGeo, Discovery, ESPN, Star, HBO, etc) , AC, phone, hot and cold shower, tub. Literally just came back to the hotel to sleep and shower as we were out the whole day. We were 4 people sharing the room. Room was only good for 2. We could have ordered an extra bed but the single beds worked out for all 4 of us. We did not notify the front desk about the extra 2 people he he) If you're on a budget, this is probably not the hotel for you. I'm sure there are many more hostels in Nathan/TST area.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Kowloon area!!”
Reviews.Author: lyekellyn
Reviews.Content: Staffs are helpful, clean and spacious room, clean bed sheet, large LCD TV with lotsa channels, good breakfast, clean bathroom, nice city view from all rooms, temple street just across the Nathan hotel, 5 mins walk to Jordan MTR station and 20 mins walk to Mongkok and lady's market, Starbucks just next to hotel lobby and free WIFI in all guest room.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helsinkicitygirl
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and comfortable rooms. Bathroom small and bit outdated otherwise room very good. Basic breakfast. Perfect location in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a central location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money in a great location and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are not as plush as they look on the Internet (they are slightly dated) and are also a lot smaller than they look in the pictures. My partner and I had booked a Nathan room because we were staying for a week so wanted the extra space that these rooms offered over the standard hotel rooms. Unfortunately the room was tiny with no closet or drawer space for unpacking, so after speaking with the reception staff (who were very helpful) we were upgraded to a suite which was considerably more spacious. The free Internet access on the Nathan floor was great and the location was perfectly situated on Nathan Road directly across from Temple Street market. All local attractions (Star Ferry, Ladies Market, shops and restaurants) are only a minimum charge cab ride away which equated to aprox £1.50 (GBP). Cabs are sometimes better value than the underground because the initial rate is aprox £1.50 (GBP) for the first 2km, and because this hotel is so central, most of the local attractions are within the 2km radius. If you are looking for something more up-market then I would recommend the Marco Polo hotel near Harbour city shopping mall, but we were out and about every day so the Nathan was a cheaper option and suited us perfectly. - have already recommended this hotel to a friend who is travelling to Hong Kong in May.

Reviews.Title: “An overall-good hotel, needs more than just extra blankets”
Reviews.Author: astriddita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is reachable from airport by airport express train and its free K1 shuttle (that will drop you next to the hotel at Eaton Hotel stop), and by the Jordan MTR Station (exit B). The location is pretty awesome; the Temple Street is nearby (better buy the cheap souvenirs at Temple Street rather than the Ladies Market)--just less than 5 minutes walk. Breakfast was so-so. The room is okay, if not standard. We stayed at the executive room that has no heater. It is pretty ridiculous to find out that the hotel only gives you two extra wool blankets to overcome the winter temperature (well, even though Hong Kong's winter is around 10 Celcius degrees). The Wifi is alright-when it doesn't work, you might want to set a static IP (192.168.x.x, etc etc).

Reviews.Title: “Get a Nathan Room”
Reviews.Author: FilipiNomad
Reviews.Content: I don't really know how the other rooms are but the Nathan Room is great. The free breakfast is delicious and free wifi was convenient. They also gave us drink vouchers for their bar which had some really good drinks. I've been to A LOT of bars and their cocktails are top notch. There's a restaurant on the same block that serves authentic Chinese food but they don't have an English menu and the restaurant staff doesn't speak any English. We ordered by pointing at the pictures on the menu. The metro is also nearby so getting around wasn't a problem. On our last day, after checking out, they let us leave our luggage locked up in the lobby so we can explore HK some more since we had a late flight. Overall, we had a great experience at Nathan Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that's Near to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Phronimos
Reviews.Content: I initially had trouble finding the hotel because its façade isn't facing the Nathan road. Eventually I found Nathan Hotel which is just beside a coffee shop. I booked a Nathan Room and just what I had expected, the room was great - clean bathroom, fresh-smelling curtains, spotless bed linens, and tidy carpet. Internet is free and fast. Switches for the lights were confusing at first but with a bit of trial and error everything worked out fine. Breakfast food is located at the top floor. They have a wide selection of breakfast food although I found the breads (and table setting) just average. One complaint is that charging electronic gadgets can be done one at a time because of the limited power outlet. Also, only one elevator was functional during my stay so I had to wait a bit longer every time I wanted to go down and/or to my room. With its great location - short walks to the nearest MTR station, money changers, convenience stores, bus stop, and even the complimentary shuttle to Airport Express Kowloon station, Nathan Hotel surely gives value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “very practical”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Silly77
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was one of the cheaper deals that I could find online in a good area that I knew was busy. The location is great! You're a 10 min walk from the MTR and it's easily accessible from the airport (AEL line) and a free shuttle to the hotel. The room was actually 'big' for HK I think. we had a lot of room for our luggage and room to walk! lol I've heard some horror stories about how small hotels and beds were and there wasnt room for your luggage. But the room and bathroom was a really good size. One thing that wasn't good was the elevator. They have two, but you're always waiting a long time for it and it's always busy, so it always stops on multiple floors.... You get free wifi from the rooms so that was a plus! one weird thing is that the "king size" bed we had was two twin mattresses pushed together! lol I found that very funny. My boyfriend wasn't feeling well when we were there so we stayed in at night, and they have a couple of good tv channels to watch too lol.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location is important”
Reviews.Author: Johnstanno
Reviews.Content: Nathan hotel is just 5mins walk from Jordan MTR (Exit A or B) which is more centralised MTR. Mongkok is a couple of station away and Tsim Sha Shui is only a station away. This very much lessen your travelling time. Hotel is very clean and they have WIFI which allows me to surf the net by just using my iphone. Definitely recommended for the location and comfortable room!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, free wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: holplanner
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huge for Hong Kong's standards although we wished the toilets were bigger. The room deco is slightly dated but it's a small compromise for the size of the room. The hotel granted our request for our 3 rooms to be as close together as possible and even gave us a free upgrade for 1 of the rooms. While the location of Prudential Hotel is better (nearer MTR, nearer better shopping), Nathan Hotel is just a 5 min walk from the nearest Jordan MTR exit and won in the area of providing free wireless internet services to its guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Alvin A
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious unlike most hongkong hotels! Rates are reasonable and competitive. I really appreciated the free internet service which other hotels charge extra for. The included breakfast buffet is excellent. Airport Express shuttle service (K1) pick up point is just outside. The hotel is in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei MTR stations making it very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: _En__Kay1_
Reviews.Content: The rooms were of a good size and modern but not extravagant. The rooms were clean and had all the usual kettle, mugs etc.. with a nice flat screen TV. We did have an issue with the electrics have frozen (not able to turn anything on or off) but they quickly sorted this out. The breakfast was also nice - a continental breakfast (what we were after) and other options. It did have wired internet access but this wasn't free - it had free wi-fi but it had a very weak connection and was extremely slow. The location is near the train stn (about 5 mins) and has a bus stop just opposite (we got the bus to the airport). The night markets etc.. are also a short walk away. This is not on HK Island itself (which is described as more of a business district). The staff were fairly friendly - it was raining quite a bit when we stayed but used the hotel umbrellas. Overall we enjoyed our stay and it was generally worry/stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable, convenient... did the job.”
Reviews.Author: MahimaAnand
Reviews.Content: Was bang on Nathan Road, the Golden Mile. Across the street from Temple Street Night Market. Walking distance to the MTR station. Small but comfy room. Simple buffet breakfast. Good option for Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Couln't find a fault”
Reviews.Author: nathansupporter
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel approx 8.00 am following our overnight flight from Australia. Was able to check in despite officially not due until 3.00pm and with just a simple upgrade enquiry from me we were upgraded from Nathan room to Nathan Grand. With the extremely polite assistance with luggage to our 12th floor room from Leo Leung (bellboy) we were settled in, unpacked and strolling along Nathan Road by 10.30am. We found every aspect of the hotel to be excellent. The room, always smiling, polite and helpful staff, breakfast and the efficient front desk at both check in and out helped to make our first trip to HK extremely pleasurable. We are already considering returning next November and we certainly wont be looking any further than The Nathan for accommodation. I am at a total loss to understand the previous November "business stay" reviewers attitude. Perhaps he/she should try booking with Expedia or something similar in future or at least ensuring they have some written confirmation of their reservation. I am sure they have many guests arrive claiming low rates but since the reviewer appears to have a poor opinion of HK practices surely some precaution would seem common sense (unfortunately it isn't always that common) The Nathan is not the Beverley Hilton but at approx AUD 200 per night including full buffet breakfast for two and 24/7 access to The Nathan Lounge with their computer use and free WiFi for your own laptop I consider it to be excellent value

Reviews.Title: “modern comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: pandc2801
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for one night stopover. Arriving at HK main line station and departing from HKIA the hotel was ideally located. Short walk to Jordan MRT station, Temple Street Markets and good shopping on busy Nathan Road. Modern, clean and well appointed rooms with many extra goodies not usually found in hotels of this grade eg choice of pillows, selection of music CD's, box of stationery items, huge safe and a floor lounge with laptops (free wifi), good coffee, soft drinks,snacks, newspapers, books,mags etc all complimentary. The restaurant serves excellent food and the hotel staff provide helpful friendly service. Would certainly stay at the Nathan Hotel again for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “DANGER!!! Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: BeijingVisitor123
Reviews.Content: The Nathan Hotel will quote one rate on the phone when you make the reservation and then double it when you arrive at 11:00 p.m., exhausted from your air travel. The rate I was quoted was 1100 HKD and the rate I had to pay was 1958 HKD. Talking to the general manager did not provide satisfaction. The hotel seems to mainly serve tour groups with discount rates arranged in advance--private guests BEWARE. HK has always had a reputation for fleecing tourists through over-charging, attempts at cheating, and downright fraud. The city is like a huge vacuum cleaner than removes whatever money a visitor has with the utmost speed and efficiency. The Nathan continues this fine tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmc1
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here before setting off to the Canton Show in Guangzhou. The hotel is modern and everything works. The internet was quick, breakfast was fine for us. Had a oriental and western set up. Clean spacious rooms and bathroom, clever design to maximise space . Got everything you will need, minibar, safe, separate shower and bath. Duvet and pillows are great. Location slap bang on the Nathan Road, yet at night the noise was not noticeable. Thank you Nathan hotel for a super stay.

Reviews.Title: “liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgie1girl_8
Reviews.Content: just got back two days ago got to say this hotel was realy good the price was fantastic stayed in the nathan room were breakfast was included the staff are realy good and nothing was to much trouble for them got the a21 bus from the airport takes about an hour drops you off stop 10 nearly near the hotel and got the bus back to the airport really easy jordon station near by the rooms nice and clean and would definately stay there again overall had a lovely holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AarthyRajnikanth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center. the room size is good, the quality is excellent.the best thing about this hotel is its clean lounge. we had two children , both enjoyed the hotel.would definitely recommend this hotel for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: imazz
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was very pleasant. Rooms were VERY spacious at a very great price. The walk to the Jordan MTR station is about a 5 minute walk. Hotel had a stale smell on many of the floors, but it was liveable. I've been to a few hotels in HK and would consider this a great balance between price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: HamptonMar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location handy to shopping and transport. The A21 bus to and from the airport is but a short walking distance away <3mins. Staff is always friendly and helpful, maybe because I speak Cantonese and had worked in the area in the 90s. My wife and I stayed 4 nights and I can recommend the hotel,its not a 5 star hotel but certainly worth the money. Arriving at the airport one should purchase an Octupus Card (for all transport in HK) at the Mass Transit Railway counter (MTR). HK$50 for the deposit of the credit size card and HK$100 in value for transport. You get a refund for the card and any unused amount at the MTR airport counter when you return the card on your departure. The A21 bus fare to the Hotel cost HK$33 or Aust$4.50 and the bus stop is only 50m from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best location & modern hotel...”
Reviews.Author: viettoan
Reviews.Content: ...We stayed at Nathan hotel, Kowloon for 3 nights in Nathan Grand room which is on Nathan floor for about 200AUD a night. It's right in the heart of the shopping district with the night market on Temple St just 2minutes walk and 5munites walk to Jordan subway. We found it quite enjonable and comfortable. The room was quite spacious and well fitted out with good in room facilities provided except the shower screen was a bit mouldy... Breakfast was included, good service but nothing spectacular. We were quite happy over all until a petty incident as we were checking out. We were asked by the receptionist where the ironing board was that we had borrowed, we told her where we put it but then we had to wait while she was on the phone checking it out. We were then asked for the location of the iron so we told her where it was but then she got back on the phone and told us that the iron was broken. When we asked to borrow the iron, we didn't notice that the lid where you fill the water was missing until we started using it but didn't think too much of it to report to the hotel. We told the receptionist the it was given to us in that condition but then the manager came out, showed us the iron and the broken lid. He was adamant the iron was in good condition when it was given to us (even though he wasn't the one that gave it to us) and told us to take responsibiity for it, even though we tried to explain that we didn't break it and asked him where he found the lid as we know it was never in the room. The manager's response was that he didn't know and he was so unconvinced by our honest explaination that if we could pay 200AUD a night for the room then it wouldn't be matter for us to take the responsibility if we did actually break the iron. It was a shame that a pleasant stay was ended with an embarassing situation caused by such a petty and false accusation... A part from the iron incident, it was a very nice hotel with friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, top location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_AU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nathan Hotel for 5 nights on business, with a room on the Nathan floor. This gives you access to the Nathan Lounge which has two PCs, a bunch of magazines and books, TV, a few couches and some light refreshments. I only really accessed this lounge to grab a fruit juice or two. Check-in and Check-out was fast and with no hassle. The room itself was well laid out with a massive (43 inch?) LCD TV. Internet was complimentary with the room for both wireless and LAN connections providing troublefree access. Both the room itself and bathroom were on the small side, with a very small closet for hanging clothes provided. The bed was super comfortable however I couldn't get absolutely comfortable with the choices of pillows. Amenities were top quality, with comfortable bath robes and complimentary slippers provided. One thing the bathroom lacked was a pull out clothes line. The air-conditioning worked very well and responded to the fan speed and temperature you set it to, a very welcoming feature if you don't like the typical temperature hotel rooms are set at. The hotel is in a great location, within 5-7 mins walk from either Jordan or Yau Ma Tei subway stations. The Starbucks on the ground floor was convenient to get a cold refreshing drink after a day out as you head up to the room. Plenty of restaurants are located nearby, as is the Temple St markets. Breakfast was included in my rate. Whilst not the biggest or most elaborate as the restaurant is quite small, there was a good selection of cold cuts, juices, breads, pastries and hot buffet, with a chef to cook your eggs/omelette the way you like it. Getting to/from the hotel is easy, either with the A or E series buses. Coming from the airport, the A21 basically drops you right in front of the hotel on Nathan Rd. You can also take this, or walk 4 mins to Jordan Rd to get an A22 or E bus to the airport, about a 45-50 minute trip. I'd highly recommend the Nathan Hotel for travellers looking for good value and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anjeneca
Reviews.Content: Nice room and breakfast at the top floor. Along Nathan road and about 5-10mins walk to the nearest train station. Many shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Nathan Hotel was an awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Patmoodley
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nathan Hotel was an awesome experience. From check in until checking out was made so seamless and delivered extra ordinary service. The staff are most helpfull and always willing to go the extra mile to make our stay comfortable.My wife and myself was overwhelmed by team at the Nathan Hotel. I wish to thank the reservation team that handled our booking. A special thank you to Mr Ariel Zapata for all your assistance and informative knowledge given to us on Hong Kong tours and shopping experiences. Thank You the Nathan Hotel team. Pat & Krishnie Moodley.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Nathan Hotel, Kowloon, Hong Kong We chose this hotel after much searching on TA, looking at price and location as our main critique. After reading all the reviews we decided to book a Nathan Room, which had access to ‘The Nathan Lounge’ with snacks, coffee and free internet access. We arrived at HK airport and got on the A21 Airport Bus, which was HK$33 each and dropped us off just near the hotel. The tourist information desk was most helpful with any enquiries we had. Upon arrival, all the staff were really friendly and helpful. We arrived at 9am and as expected our room wasn’t ready but after a quick coffee in the attached Starbucks, we found we were able to get into the room! The room was nicely appointed, everything clean and tidy, it was big enough for a couple of nights, but I think we would have struggled a little if we were stopping longer due to there being no where to store our suitcases. The bathroom was a nice size, with a good shower. The bed was comfy and there was a large LCD TV with plenty of channels. The room had free WiFi which was really good as we had a laptop with us. We only visited the Nathan Lounge once, there were a couple of computers but it was much smaller than it looks on the website, as we had WiFi in the room we didn’t need the free internet access in there either. Breakfast was included in our deal, we only had breakfast once as we were away too early on our last day. The breakfast was a buffet, there was a selection of hot and cold food, it was OK, neither great nor rubbish. The only real problem with the hotel was the lifts, there were only two and one of them was out of order for our whole stay, which meant waiting for what seemed like an age as they travelled up and down! The hotel is well placed to visit all the touristy sites, Temple Street Market just over the road, and an easy 30 minute walk down Nathan Road to get toward the ferries to get to Hong Kong Island, or a cheap taxi ride. The MRT is nearby and there are lots of buses and taxis around. The hotel has a nice rooftop bar called The Bali, this was a nice place to relax after a long day walking around in the humidity, there were a couple of vouchers in the room to use for ‘buy one, get one free’ and a good happy hour too. In summary, it’s a nice hotel in a good location, would stop there again for the right price but would maybe choose somewhere different next time for a change.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, very good location, but not the grand Hyatt thats for sure”
Reviews.Author: Nadymm
Reviews.Content: pros: very good location, just less than a 4 minutes walk to the jordan station and a 10 minutes walk to the heart of kowloon very modern hotel very near to the night market very comfortable beds breakfast worth the extra cost, large variety in a very nice restaurant very good room service and spacious rooms starbucks right downstairs a travelling agency in the lobby that offers good packages to macau and china cons: not exactly in the richest areas of HK, even though nathan road is a very dynamic axe that leads directly to the victoria harbour area etc.. not exactly the gym a body builder would want, but good enough to entertain you for a few hours we had free wifi in our room, but that was pure chance as the other room we had booked did not have it and the connection is supposed to be paid maybe the front desk needs some improving as we were not given the double bed we had requested, but 2 seperate beds instead the internet rooms doesnt really exist: its only two computers that are always busy, so think twice about it if u need to work online the whole time! definitely a hotel i would recommend for tourists who seek a medium cost hotel, a typical 4 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO SATAY!”
Reviews.Author: anita99999
Reviews.Content: Three other family members and I spent 10 nights at the Nathan Hotel and found the accommodations quite comfortable...the staff, very helpful and efficient...the location, most convenient. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. All the staff were friendly and went out of their way to help. We will definitely plan to stay at the Nathan on return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: summerly
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Nathan Room with free internet and breakfast for 4nights. Quite satisfied, however when we first checked in, they gave us a smoking room instead of a nonsmoking which I requested for when booking through Zuji. So maybe that's Zuji's fault. Location was okay, easy enough to navigate. Room was quite fantastic, but be warned, there is no bathtub in the Nathan Room. We were told that tubs were only available in suites. No view to speak of but that's expected in a city hotel. Access to Nathan Lounge was much appreciated, as we could use the computer sets from there. Breakfast was nothing to be wowed at, and they kept running out of dimsum all the days we were there for breakfast. Saw some locals visiting the restaurant and ordering ala carte dimsum so maybe we should have done that! Also we were given two vouchers for 1for1 drinks at their Bali Bar. Worth a visit to sit and chill out and the manager Charles was very friendly. Still, value for money for what I paid. The room itself was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Just A Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MeizhenSG
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 Executive Rooms with 3 extra beds for 4 nights (20th - 24th Jun) and everything was well arranged. Furthermore, we got a free upgrade for one of the Executive Room with extra bed to a Triple bed room Location is good just about 7 mins walk to Jordan MTR and Temple Street. Staff is friendly & efficient. Especially the house cleaning lady did a gd job on the daily house cleaning and the receptionist. One thing they can add on maybe free wireless service would be an advantage. I'll definitely choose this hotel again on my return trip to HK this Sep =)

Reviews.Title: “Check more than one elevator is working before you book...”
Reviews.Author: annieob08
Reviews.Content: We booked a Nathan Grand room and breakfast deal for four nights from June 21, a choice based entirely on online reviews and photo's. The room itself was excellent - spacious and clean - although the bathroom was small and the shower only adequate. The walls were very thin, as we found out when a loud family with excessively boisterous children (who delighted in throwing themselves off the walls and conjoinging door ) moved into the adjacent room. Still, we weren't too concerned as we were out most days. On the other hand, we were greatly frustrated by the elevator situation in the hotel. They only have two elevators, but during our stay only one was in service...for the entire hotel. We spent nearly as much time standing around in lobbies waiting for the elevator as we did in our room. And when the overworked elevator eventually did arrive, it was inevitably packed full, very hot and stuffy, and smelling suspiciously as if it was overheating from the continued exertion. We asked the desk staff politely when the second elevator would be fixed, and were told by the unhelpful female staff member it would be on Thursday, and yes, we could use the service elevator if we had to. Needless to say, Thursday came and went without any developments and when we left on the Friday afternoon, there was still only one elevator slaving away. The service elevator option was somewhat helpful, but cramming into a dodgy old lift with trolleys full of dirty dishes and laundry wasn't exactly the image we had of our hotel stay in HK. On the subect of staff, the concierge, bell hops and doorman were all very helpful and polite. Thank you in particular to Leo. Unfortunately the same couldn't be said for the female desk clerks - they were brusque, unhelpful and borderline rude. Some training in customer service skills wouldn't go amiss. Other amenities - the Nathan Lounge was handy, the gym was small and musty, and the Bali bar was good value with 2 for 1 drinks. Finally - the buffet breakfast. On the positive side, there was plenty of food and the service was okay. On the downside....the choice of breakfast food was one of the strangest we've ever seen. Mashed potatoes, green beans and zucchini, tuna pasta mornay, blue cheese....some very strange options. Still, the food was plentiful and more than adequate, once we got past the unusual options. In summary, if you're thinking of booking at the Nathan, check if both elevators are working otherwise you'll be very frustrated at the amount of time you'll spend hanging around waiting. Don't be surprised by the lack of friendliness from the female desk staff. And be prepared for some adventurous breakfast options. And in comparison to our experiences at other hotels in HK, no, we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gypsyjaneOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: For the best rooms go for the Nathan Rooms they are worth the extra. The hotel is clean and the staff are excellent or room attendant was absolutely fantastic but I would say one member of staff at reception should practise smiling a bit more. The lifts were a bit of a problem as only one was working but that was not a major issue. The location is great, just across the road and down any of the side streets is Temple Street Market and there is an eatery there called The Spicey Crab, delicious food annd an experience in it's self. Go for an Octopus card it will get you everywhere. Kowloon and Hong kong Island are very safe places to visit at no time did I feel apprehensive. Go for it and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoting
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights. It wasn't very close to many tourist attractions but it was pretty close (< 2 min walk) to an underground station. The rooms were a good size with decent bathrooms. Unfortunately, it was a while ago so I can't remember many specifics. I do remember that when one of our toilets malfunctioned, they sent someone up immediately to repair

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ~ Comfortable Room ~ Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: peach6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our 1st trip to hong kong in may for 5 days. They couldn'f find our booking, But finally they did and upgraded us to a Nathan Floor Room with Free Wifi for the inconvenience! Rooms - were small (expected in hong kong tho), bed very comfortable, decor was very nice. Television was Huge and the rooms have a large safe as well. Wifi in the room was very fast on a phone. There is a roof top bar with delicious cocktails, fairly cheap compared to australian prices. There is a happy hour 5-9pm 2 for 1 cocktails. We visited the bar every night for a drink or 2. There is also a starbucks on ground floor, which was very convenient. Nathan Hotel is in a great location on nathan road, a few minutes walk to Jordan MTR station, about 2 streets away from the Temple St Night Markets. Chemist, MacDonalds and ATM's are all on nathan road too. We would definately stay here again, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: brighteyeDurban
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the special. pay for two nights and get one night free. Excellent hotel. location. near subways and plenty buses to take you anywhere. We only booked a hotel and did all our travel on our own and saw more places than a booked tour, having crossed many islands. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We wanted a road facing room and by the next day, this was arranged. Booking online was defnitely cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “good stop”
Reviews.Author: tobytwoNewJersey
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights very good location room was very nice and clean forgot to ask for non smoking when booking though Agoda service (Also very good) the room was smoking but did not smell that bad . right on the main drag 2 blocks from the temple night market also steps from were the free bus from the airport train depot leaves you off breakfast was fine

Reviews.Title: “Good price - good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: NL2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, fancy, clean, staff very polite. The room was big and comfortable (although the bathtub looked more like a coffin..kinda creepy). The hotel offers lounge bar on the top floor, classy restaurant and a starbucks (pretty useful if you don't wake up in time for the breakfast time). Only one issue: the cleaning staff is pretty loud during the morning round, which starts around 8am. Value for money is perfect, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, good food ... all good”
Reviews.Author: geoffps
Reviews.Content: This mid range place has been refubished well. The room we had was a 'Nathan room' and had the extra bonus of being on same floor as the lounge which had coffee machine, some snacks, PCs with net acess, books, mags and cable access. Bed was comfortable, room was quiet, lots of wood and very stylish. New bathroom. Very clean and well serviced. The hotel isn't huge, so breakfast was not a huge affair like it is in some bigger places. Food was good and so was the coffee. Can't really fault our stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The location on Nathan Road is great for HK shopping and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean,”
Reviews.Author: TB10er
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Nathan Hotel and have got to say it was really good. The location is faultless, (stop 10 of bus route A21 from HKG). Jordan MTR is less than 2 mins away. The hotel is clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable and well serviced.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers58
Reviews.Content: We found the Nathan exactly what we expected. The room was small but adequate and had all the facilities that we needed. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was at the end of a hall and quiet. The location also was great, close to the MTR and the hotel also provided a free shuttle to the ferry terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Francogirl
Reviews.Content: We found the Nathan Hotel perfect for our needs.We booked a large room with free internet access,which worked very well,with a super fast connection.The rooms were spotlessly clean,the King size bed was extremely comfortable,and the air conditioning worked well.The breakfast was included in our package, as was access to the Nathan Lounge with free tea and coffee 24 hours.In fact it was a really pleasant stay and we plan on returning very soon.The only thing I would change if possible is instead of having two wash hand basins in the lovely large bathroom,it would be better to put in two toilets,one off the living space and one off the bedroom,but this is merely a suggestion not a complaint.All in all this is a 4 star hotel that I would recommend to anyone visiting Kowloon or Hong Kong Island as there is easy access to public transport,or use the really cheap red cabs to go sight seeing easily and quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Mongs
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 4 generations and apart for a slight delay in getting one of the rooms ready, there is really no complain to the services and rooms. The rooms are big and my 2 and 4 years old have plenty of room to run around. It's very unlike those small Hong Kong hotels. The beds are single beds and we thought they are super singles but we managed to survive with the kids sleeping with us. We arranged for a airport transfer at the end of our trip and the bell boy and the manager was very helpful and the rate is reasonable at HKD450 for the 7 adults and 2 kids with all our luggages. The hotel is a short walk from Jordan MTR and the weather is good enough for a short walk in Feb but there is no escalator going down the train station so parents with young children in prams will have to have the child getting out of the pram and bringing the pram down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: CalvinHobbes111
Reviews.Content: The location is great, nearby Temple Street and short walk to Jordan MTR station. Several markets and lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The Nathan floor room was excellent, clean and comfortable - good value for money. There was wifi available in the Nathan floor, but didn't work very well. On the other hand, there was ethernet cable in the room. The bed was a little bit short. Breakfast was "just ok".

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Rohit_Garg
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get an additional bed which was for HK$350 . We were advised to upgrade to a suite for HK$400 with additional bed included. Staff is friendly and location is very convenient to move around

Reviews.Title: “Consistently all you can ask for!!”
Reviews.Author: billyboy9501
Reviews.Content: Consistently all you can ask for!! We write this review after our third stay at the Nathan Hotel and once again found the quality of service and facilities outstanding. Staff always friendly and courteous and willing to assist us with any requests. The rooms are the cleanest we have ever stayed in and the shower pressure is great. The Nathan is located only a few minutes from excellent shopping and Temple Street Markets which make a Shoppers Dream place to stay. Nearby you will find good eating places and these serve up some very delicious dishes. As for getting around Hong Kong we suggest you buy an Octopus Card and load it with HKD$150 and this will allow you quick and easy use of the MTR, Bus and Ferries to the outer Islands. There is a HKD$50 deposit paid for the card but this and any unused credit it refunded when you return the card to any MTR Service Counter. Stay at the Nathan Hotel and you will be guaranteed a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Navy35
Reviews.Content: This is my sixth visit to Hong Kong, and I only stay in Kowloon area. This was the first time I had stayed at the Nathan, and I was not disappointed. The hotel has under gone some major room renovations, making it a very competitive hotel. But, as far as I'm concerned, the best thing the Nathan hotel has going for it, is it's location - on Nathan Rd, about half way between the star ferry and Mongkok (markets). The MTR is is literally around the corner from it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a treat city”
Reviews.Author: worldstitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way to New Zealand from the UK. The room was great providing us with everything we needed and more - from tea and coffee making facilities to a razor set and comb. Breakfast was included in the rate we paid and was very comprehensive - cereals, fruit, cooked, chinese and continental style meat, cheese and pastries - even decaffinated coffee! Well positioned for all that Hong Kong has to offer - just a couple of blocks from the Temple Street night market and easy walking distance to the MTR. Would stay there again. Had an evening meal in the restaurant which was very nice although they had a limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel but good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: DavidAstley
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking executive room at the Nathan Hotel on a prepaid promo package, and when I arrived the receptionist told me that they had run out of non-smoking rooms – so were upgrading me to a non-smoking suite. What a nice surprise! So I really can't fault this hotel because I had a great stay and got much more for my money than I expected. The restaurant that they use for breakfast gets very crowded at peak times, but given that I was enjoying the comforts of a nice suite for the price of a promo package, I shouldn't complain! One good point about the Nathan Hotel that I didn't realise when I booked it is that there is a bus stop for the shuttle bus to the Kowloon Airport Express station just 50 metres from the entrance in Pak Hoi Street. I didn't realise that the hotel was on that route because I think the stop is labeled as the Eaton Hotel (which is opposite). So that makes getting from the airport very cost effective and convenient. Although the Nathan Hotel is a fair way up Nathan Road (a good 20-25 minutes walk down to the harbour) it is only 5 minutes walk to the Jordan MTR station, which makes getting around Hong Kong quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a central location!”
Reviews.Author: Svitata
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had originally booked a room at Novotel Nathan but due to a technical hiccup, our reservation was cancelled and we decided on Nathan Hotel for our 3-night stay. I had been mentally preparing myself for small Executive room (we are in Hong Kong) and was pleasantly surprised when the hotel upgraded us to their Nathan Floor Room when we checked in. They had recently renovated the hotel and the Nathan Floor is one of the areas that was revamped. I must say they did a nice job as the room floor was cozy and warm, yet trendy. The same design theme extends into their rooms as well. It was small, but with a creative mind, they managed to fit a lot of amenities inside without the room feeling cramped. Although, I did find the bathroom a little tight, but that is easily overlooked since I don't spend a whole lotta time there. The check-in was quick and painless, and most of the staff are friendly and eager to help. For a small room, it is very well appointed. The queen bed was comfortable and they have really soft, fluffy pillows. You're also given a menu to choose the pillow you want! The large LCD TV is more than adequate and a 2.1 channel sound system with DVD player is provided as well. If you prefer your own music, there is an audio jack for you to hook up your MP3 player to the sound system. Do you really want to leave the room? Personally, I think the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is situated along Nathan Road, close to big shopping malls and a myriad of restaurants. The MTR station is barely 3 mins walk away, the airport Citybus A21 (from airport to Nathan Hotel)stops right in front of the hotel, and the K1 (complimentary Airport Express bus which picks up passengers taking the Airport Express train) stops right beside the hotel as well. This is really fuss-free travelling if you ask me! Don't fret if you're thinking of getting a room without breakfast, there are plenty of options available just round the corner. The Tsui Wah Restaurant a few doors to the right of the hotel serves decent meals or you can also try the Nathan Congee and Noodle restaurant, which is located 2 streets away along Saigon Street. Their congee is delicious! You can generally get a nice hearty breakfast at about US$2-4 at such places. If you're too lazy to walk, there's always Starbucks right at the hotel lobby. All in all, a nice trendy hotel with good service, superb location and excellent value. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuicyLife
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Like all HK hotels, the room is small, but not terribly so. I do recommend upgrading to one of the "Nathan Rooms" as the free internet and the more modern rooms are worth it. The bar on the rooftop is great, definitely worth a visit. The breakfasts are terrific, about the best we had (try and get an omelette and a newspaper). The location is great, right on Nathan Road, but with the entrance just up a side street, so a bit quieter. Try and go the Four Seasons hotel for a meal at their three Michelin starred restaurant - lunch is a total bargain. Would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for families on a budget, to relax and see the sights of this great city”
Reviews.Author: Marcellus61
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nathan was a truly remarkable experience for the entire family. Travelling with 3 kids, aged 10-18, was not always easy, but the staff at the Nathan Hotel went out of their way to make our five nights there, one of the most memorable experiences of our 6 week holiday. We were given adjoining rooms, which gave us all enough space and the necessary distance as well. The rooms are spacious, quiet and kept immaculately clean. There was no outside noise at all. The view of Nathan Road is nothing spectacular, but the proximity to the street markets and public transport more than make up for that. The kids loved the gym on the 6th floor, but note that there is no pool. Prior to arrival we thought this might be a concern, but there is more than enough to keep all occupied in HK. Within a minute the obliging doorman will hail a taxi for you to get to the dock for a fare of HKD25. A Star Ferry ride for a family of five to Hong Kong Island was about HKD12 - incredible value. A taxi ride to the Ladies and Electronics Markets, costs between HK20-25, depending on the traffic. We highly recommend the Night Market on Temple Street, only two blocks from The Nathan. There the intrepid explorer will unearth a bargain at every street stall. The Night Market stretches for 5 city blocks and will easily tie up the die hard shopper for hours - at least until midnight when the vendors shut down for the night. The Jade Market is a short step further along, but closes at 6pm. Jordan Station is five minutes walk away along Nathan Road, which gave us ready access to the rest of this stunning city. The rail network in HK is unbelievably efficient and modern. The people of HK are incredibly polite and generous. The staff at the Nathan were no exception. The level of personal service was extraordinary. Even the doorman went out of his way to help us with our inquiries about transport and tourist destinations. On our last day they happily bundled our luggage for us in the lobby while we went off for a last shopping excursion prior to our airport transfer. We prearranged airport transfers with the Nathan Hotel because we were newbies to the locale and had a large amount of luggage and kids in tow. The driver was brilliant. He was justly proud of his city and very happy to answer our questions as we drove along. At HKD450 per transfer it's not cheap. Now that we know how good the public transport is, next time I'd opt for that. Catch the train to Jordan Station and walk the two blocks to the Nathan. Contrary to another reviewer, We loved the buffet breakfasts. There was some variety each day, sufficient to placate our temperamental, diet faddish 18 yr old. In the evenings the Penthouse restaurant offered choice at reasonable prices. The Bali Bar offered an exotic late night retreat at the end of a busy day of sightseeing. We so loved Hong Kong and particularly our stay at the Nathan, that we want to go back. Soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms - but broken elevators”
Reviews.Author: unnsing
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel during our visit to HK. The location is convenient, about 100 m from the Jordon subway station. We were able to upgrade to a penthouse suite so our room was spacious and had 2 tv's! The cleaning staff was wonderful and we never once had to request for anything. Amenities included, restaurant (we never tried), a thai-style bar (didn't try), gym (very small but minimal equipment but did the job), and had a Starbucks connected to the lobby (free WiFi). The biggest complaint we have is that during our 5 days there, there was only 1 functioning elevator - the other was broken and we never saw any repair people even attempt to fix it. Therefore, there was always a line in the lobby for the elevator and you had to wait quite some time. Also, in the only working elevator, there was some video adversement that was not working properly and would therefore give the effects of strobe lights the entire ride - very weird. Overall though, we had a pleasant stay. Hope they will have fixed the elevators when you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, boutique style rooms, brilliant staff - rubbish breakfast”
Reviews.Author: philtraveller
Reviews.Content: The wise old hotel saying goes: "don't spioil the hotel for a ha'penny of grub" (* for those who don't know this is stolen from the saying "don't spoil the ship for a half-penny of tar".. as in tar used to seal the joints on old sailing ships...ok...) ..and this saying so nearly is the downfall of the Nathan. in Nov 2009 the rooms have been refurbished to a stylish boutique hotel standard, the staff are helpful beyond human understanding.. and the location is excellent for the fantastic street markets etc in Kowloo. (public transport in Hong Kong is superb, so it;s only a short taxi or even beter subway trip to Hong Kong itself. My tip - don't bother trying to stay in "downtown" Hong Kong, the Nathan Road is great and nothing's far away...also HK is very safe, so getting about on foot, buses etc is fine. BUT the ha'penny of tar inthis case... breakfast!!!! I've rarely had such an appallingly bland and unappetising choice of buffet breakfast. Crap rolls, stale pastries, vile coffee and tea, . . saving grace was a chef making fresh omlettes to order. If we were lucky they had a little fresh melon chopped up. Back on the plus side ... they have FREE internet PCs in the guest lounges on each floor, big TVs, and once again, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kentwong
Reviews.Content: Pros Location, Location, Location; friendly service, Cons Room seems not as big as advertised, maybe that's the standard Hong Kong way to advertising marketing space instead of actual usage space. Overall, We love to stay here. We booked Nathan Grant room with two single beds at 12th floor for 8 nights. Our room face Nathan room but hardly hear the noise from the street. good air flow, non-smoking room; comfort firm bed with soft pillow top. The room seems not as big as advertised 340 - 370 sq. ft. I guess as Hong Kong standard, it's good size room already. This is my first time stay in Hong Kong hotel, I only compare to 4 stars US hotel standard. This is small hotel. Check in lobby looks more a 3 stars hotel, very small. Other than the room size, everything else is very nice in Nathan Hotel. Everyone very professional here, I feel very welcome to stay here. If you need to use internet and take breakfast, you should book Nathan Grant room. We may stay here again if the deal is right.

Reviews.Title: “the one to choose when booking in HK gives you headache”
Reviews.Author: mistaQ
Reviews.Content: Went there on a month of december and booked trough the information airport counter. The price was not cheap and being in the hospitality business i had high expectation...and i found everything perfect. The rooms amenities were great and service excellent. The hotel is located a short ride by MTR to downtown HK, and reachable from a short walk to Tsim Sha tsui, were you can enjoyed the stunning view on HK skyline. It is my favorite choice in town and if you cant afford big hotels names and do not want the thrill of in night in a guest house, this one will meet your expectations. Best Value/Money...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: JulieandRod
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days in great room. Not the cheapest, but better value than we've had in other cities. Extremely comfortable and convenient. The bed was huge with great mattress, down doona and a choice of pillows. We were delighted with the size of the room as other reviews had warned of small room size. Air conditioning was good, tours offered were very good, and staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet became a bit boring and there was no cows milk....but plenty of food, and it was included in the price. There's a coffee shop attached to the foyer which provided good coffee and yummy snacks. We'd definitely come back given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “OK for location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: argasp
Reviews.Content: The Nathan hotel is a good, average four-star hotel. It's main attraction is the relatively decent value for money you get. The rooms are quite nice and the staff are helpful but a bit hard to communicate with. Internet access is very expensive, a real turnoff. Breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “handy to MTR, markets, and eating places”
Reviews.Author: annme
Reviews.Content: The second time I have stayed here. While not a top of the range hotel, it does offer good value. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, service was fine, breakfast basic but no complaints - especially as I didn't have to shop for it or cook it! Close to the Jordan MTR and the Temple Street night markets where we ate at the Aberdeen fish restaurant. Great food. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Caring Staff -great in an emergency”
Reviews.Author: MoogerahMan
Reviews.Content: Early this month my wife and I stayed for 2 nights with friends and my brother. We were well looked after. The rooms were excellent, good size for a major city, lots of towels and lovely linens. The breakfast was good with eggs cooked to order and both European and Chinese breakfast dishes.anything we asked a reception was dealt with perfectly and we were given a late checkout and then offered to store our bags and the luggage porter even gave us advice as to what was the most cost-effective way to get to the airport. Two weeks later my brother was booked in for one night on his way back to UK. His wallet was stolen at Brisbane airport.he arrived at the hotel with no credit cards and very little money he was helped to e-mail me and the hotel asked if I would guarantee a credit card for his stay. So a potential disaster turned into a restful nights break from the long call from Australia to UK. A big thank you to all the staff at the Nathan hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convenient Kowloon hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4leaf1981
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel were very good for the price and the breakfast was excellent. But really the best bit of this hotel was the convenience to the airport express train (free shuttle bus from the nearest station stops at the hotel, albeit the last stop on the route) and to the MRT, which is the easiest way to get around Hong Kong. The staff were also very helpful - even gave us back our same room when we had to book an extra night after our flight out was cancelled at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritz79
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hong Kong before and paid a premium price for the Shangri-La hotel… so we were a bit concerned about how we would feel at the Nathan. However we were REALLY pleasantly pleased. We booked direct with the hotel as the rates were the best around at that time. We booked a Nathan studio suite which included access to the Nathan lounge and breakfast. On arrival at the Nathan Hotel we were upgraded to the Nathan Suite free of charge. It was an amazing room with a nice street view and near the Nathan lounge. I can’t rave enough about these rooms, 2 large lcd tvs, a separate lounge, huge bathroom with twin sinks… lovely powerful shower and the bedroom itself was lovely and modern. No problems with the temperature or cleanliness and the bed…. I wish I could have taken that back home with me… best bed I’ve ever slept on! The location of this hotel is a short distance away from Jordan tube station and nearby lots of shops. A street or 2 away from Temple Street night market and a short taxi or tube ride away from most other places. We largely used their inexpensive underground system very easily and on hotter days we jumped in cabs for ease. Breakfast was buffet style and ok… I only say this as the choice for vegetarians is limited but still I never went hungry during our long stay. Hubby loved the non-vegetarian selection and it definitely is worth adding onto your package if its not included in the price. I cant comment on the other rooms but we’ll definitely be returning to use the great priced Nathan Suites. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in reasonably good location”
Reviews.Author: ozgwm2000
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at the Nathan Hotel on MANY occasions, and will be staying there for another month in November coming. What seems interesting for me is seeing the variation of critiques from different guests regarding the rooms. Let's clear some things up, as I understand them. Firstly, you get what you pay for, By that I mean that they have a range of rooms from their "economy" rooms (which I have NEVER used...) to their so-called Nathan Rooms. I always stay in a Nathan Room, or their so-called Nathan Grand Rooms. These are an excellent size, fully equiped including a large plasma TV, free internet connection, good size bathroom, and a very large in-room safe capable of holding several laptop computers. All "Nathan" rooms include breakfaast which is a reasonably good buffet spread. I love this hotel, having stayed at a number of similar-standard hotels in Hong Kong, but always keep coming bak to the Nathan Hotel. I have always found staff to be friendly and cooperative and efficient, rooms clean etc. It's located about 5 minutes walk north of the Jordan MTR metro station. A mandatory Hong Kong visitor requirement is to have an Octopus smartcard. These are AMAZING, and means you can get by with almost no cash in your pocket. Strongly recommended and VERY useful. Finally, back to the Nathan Hotel for a moment, about the only "odd> thing about this hotel is that the elevators do not go to the top floor where the restaurant is located. You need to take the elevator to it's top location (14th floor, I think it is...) then take the stairs to another level for the restaurant. Only a very minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just a little far out”
Reviews.Author: gh84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nathan Hotel for 3nights and there is nothing bad we can say about it apart from the fact that it was perhaps a little further out than we thought. Although the hotel itself is located about 5mins walk to the tube and it is only 1stop away from the harbour. Room was big, nice bathroom - all very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast very impressive, lots of choice. Overall, a really nice hotel. We would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small room”
Reviews.Author: ausytraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through asiarooms.com. It is located in the heart of Kowloon.The hotel is situated in the middle of the strip where the action is in terms of shopping and more shopping. It is 2 minutes walk from Jordan train station. And next door to the hotel there is a bakery, boutiques and restaurants. The room was left to be desired. It was very small. Could barely fit our suitcases in the room. But from looking at the photos posted by other trip advisors, the hotel may have had a makeover. Or maybe we booked the cheaper room. The walls were thin and I could hear every noise made known to man from top floor, next door and below(ie; toilet flushing/showering). I could even smell cigarette smoke seeping in to our room. About 12 midnight my friend and I could hear vacuuming noises. I am assuming the cleaners have a graveyard shift. Thus, finding it difficult to have a good night’s sleep. The staff were not friendly at the reception and small. But the location was fabulous, and everything is cheap in Hong Kong. There was an optomerist nearby that could make new spectacles within a day and at an affordable price. Which is a rare treasure when living in Australia. Location was great but unfortunately, difficult to get any refreshing sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RogueTravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the price, was a little hesitant on staying here as I can be fussy, but once arrived was very happy, defnately not 3 star more 4 star 14 floors boutique hotel, stayed in the Nathan Grand Room 10th floor for a week from the 30th July to 5 August, hotel has been renovated & is very modern, room is exaclty like the pictures on the internet site, which was very good to see, size is very good, big plasma TV, modern, very clean, comfortable & no outside noise. If you stay in a Nathan room you get access to the Nathan lounge which is great & very useful with free internet (speed was very good), tv, books & tea/coffee/drinks snacks complementry, worth paying that bit extra for one of the Nathan category rooms (Nathan Floor) in my opinion, seems most negative views for the nathan hotel are from guests that have chosen one of the standard rooms. Staff where very helpful with whatever I needed from places to shop or tours, only two downsides of the hotel was: the elevators are slow, as there is only two elveators you can be waiting a little for the lift to arrive & the second downside was the breakfast which I thought was very average if you have to pay for it its not worth the 98hkd they are charging, but if you book the hotel through sites like www.expedia.com.au you will likely get breakfast free in the hotel package. Location is excellent with shopping, transport & restaurants at your door step, be careful of the taxi drivers they will take you the long way & try to over charge you if they know you are new to HK happend to us a few times, for clubs & bars go to Lan Kwai Fong very pumping strip of bars & clubs with many tourists & locals you will know what I mean when you go, but be prepared to pay ridiculously high prices for drinks in the clubs/bars, shopping try Harbour City for there biggest shopping centre with all the latest fashion, or just walk the street & you will find store after store everywhere you turn, thought HK was great place to visit, very fast life style & will go back again. Found EXPEDIA was the cheapest place to book this hotel, travel agents where up to 30%-40% higher. Would defnately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker standard”
Reviews.Author: joshalyn
Reviews.Content: This Hotel only deserve 1 STAR. It is a VERY basic hotel (BACKPACKER STANDARD) and the staff (WITH EXCEPTION OF THE STAFF AT THE TOUR DESK ) aren't the most helpful or pleasant staff we have ever come across. The location is very good, BUT there is a really Lovely hotel with GREAT FACILITIES ETC, just across the road from the hotel entrance called the "EATON". If you do decide to stay, very CAREFULLY check your bill!!!! I can't remember how many hotels we have stayed at in the past 2 years, but this is the first major disapointment, Shame! The Night markets have some good food stalls, just go to the ones with the biggest crowds. Buy the OctopusTravel Cards from the Airport or the the underground stations. There is a bus from the airport which stops along Nathan street. A21. Its more convenient than the underground train for Nathan Street.

Reviews.Title: “Starbucks”
Reviews.Author: EivindO
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Kowloon, with ideal location. Short way to shopping district and metro. Starbucks on the hotels first floor is a plus. There is also a great bar on the roof of the hotel. The room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Moira13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week it was great in one word. We had the Nathan Grand Room and i really loved the space it was big enough for 2 persons. The bathroom is not so really big but ok to take a shower. The bed is great what a soft matras loved it. The breakfast was ok but nog really special. We also had a drink in the Bali Cafe but it is very expensive for a drink. I love to shop that was here not a problem and everything is nearby. The internet was included in the roomrate and was fine. The train was also very nearby what is great. If i ever come back i will stay again in Nathan Hotel but only the Nathan Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent service; good value”
Reviews.Author: wme79736
Reviews.Content: The Nathan offers good value in Hong Kong where at present good value is around every corner. The days when we had to look hard for the high quality cheap hotels are momentarily over as we can allafford to stay at the expensive ones owing to the exchange rate. The Nathan should remeber this as it offers good value on an extrememly inconsistent basis. Promises are made and not kept. This is the recurring theme of the reviews on this site. I found the Nathan to be excellent value. The simple rooms were of high quality and were quiet and comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and adequate. The housekeeping was efficient and invisible.
