However having been informed that the room rate included breakfast, an almighty fuss ensued when we took our places in the restaurant where we were told bluntly to pay or leave. I asked the restaurant manager to hold his fire while I went in search of the hotel duty manager who argued with me at first but after I informed him quite clearly that we had been told that breakfast was included in the price he apologized, went to the restaurant and directed the restaurant manager to stop making such a fuss, then came to our table and apologized again. By this time the other 15 or 20 people in the breakfast buffet were politely concentrating so hard on their food to try to ignore the fuss going on about them that it is a miracle they did not inhale quarts and quarts of congee porridge. This entire incident should never have occured, as should none of the others concerning the Nathan which are reported on this site. Needless to say we did not return to the breakfast buffet during the remainder of our stay, with the happy resultthat we discovered the Eaton Hotel breakfast buffet to which we will always return when staying at theNathan as it is cheaper and ten times better than the Nathan Hotel's buffet. It is just as close as it is across a narrow street and up a delightful glass elevator ride to the roof. The Nathan might remember the proximity of competition such as this when they fail to establish consistent levels of service as they so often seem to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nathan Hotel in May this year and on arrival were immediately upgraded to a suite. Plenty of room with good facilities. There were twin beds and we would have prefered a double bed, but I did not question staff about this. As they were all most helpful, I doubt that changing the sleeping arrangements would have been a problem. As others have said, the location is great, close to good eating spots, markets, transport etc. Added extras were the good quality toiletries in the bathroom including toothbrush and toothpaste! There was also an in room hotel safe - great so that you don't have to carry documents everywhere with you while sight seeing. Only down side was the lack of tourist information in the room and also lack of information in the foyer of the hotel. The closest tourist information centre is at the Star Ferry terminal, which is a bit of a walk from the hotel and the information would have been useful prior to walking to the ferry area. Overall a really good hotel in a good location in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MeganTL
Reviews.Content: Good location. Hotel is clean but the size of the room is very small, which is not Executive Room, as indicated in website. My husband and I were terribly disappointed with the service. We requested a king-sized bed and the hotel staff claimed that it was not written in their record, though i have showed him the printed out email which clearly indicated "king-size bed". Instead of accomodating our request, yes, he gave us a room with "king-size bed" but actually 2 single-beds combined as ONE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence26
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The hotel looks beautiful inside and out. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We stayed there for a week and only had one complaint, the hotel didn't have a pool. We would definitely stay here again when we come back to the great city of Hong Kong. The hotel is minutes away from the subway and walking distance to the water. The hotel was very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for Hong Kong shopping”
Reviews.Author: UkSue51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near the Jordan MTR - Staff friendly helpful and for a change cheefull. Rooms large and airy bathrooms good standard - we had a suit which consisted of two rooms fresh fruit and water daily. Staff only to happy to help - Restaurant food goode Bar/Lounge comfortable and snacks available The hotel is situated in a brilliant place for shopping and getting around - as near the MTR The jewellers attached to the Hotel is also good - the staff here are also pleasant and happy to assist. Would use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kcdn
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 Executive rooms, 1 room for 2 adults with 1 child and the other room with extra bed for 2 adults with 2 children and I asked for free upgrade and they upgraded to Execute Suite. Overall is good, the room is spacious and clean. Their staff are friendly. Locations is convenient. We took bus A21 from airport to hotel. Less then 5 mins walk from the bus stop to hotel. On return we took the Airport Free Shuttle Bus K1 route to Kowloon station for in-town checkin and took the Airport MTR. The K1 route's bus stop is only a few steps away from hotel (right in front of 7/11). Very convenient. The hotel location is good, less then 10 mins walk to Jordan station and is very near to Temple Street.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MultiTripper
Reviews.Content: Our 8th time in Hong Kong and - thanks to reading reviews on tripadvisor -we found a decent priced hotel with an excellent location. We took the A21 bus from airport which stopped very close to the hotel at 7.30pm and on checking in we were very pleased to be given an upgrade to a bigger room. Great room but the bathroom was small. Just loved the location - bus stops on the doorstep or just walk to Star ferry. We needed the exercise with all the great food we had! Hotel breakfast was good, but restaurant very busy so the delicious dim sum soon vanished and staff took a while to replace items. We liked the rooftop bar but the drinks were pricey - even with their special promotion on. All staff were friendly and helpful. A good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for All”
Reviews.Author: Marcojb12
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a fantastic holiday staying in The Nathan Hotel for 1 wk. Its in a good location for shops and markets etc and is near to Jordan MTR. There is a Starbucks located in the lobby which can be also conveniant. We had a Nathan Grand room which was very spacious for 2 people, the bathroom was modern with a fantastic shower which included a good range of complementary toiletries. There are bathrobes and slippers provided also.There was 3 or 4 plug sockets available not including the ones already in use dispite previous reveiws however not sure if this was because we was on a Nathan floor? Air con worked fine and was a god send after comming in from the humid hot weather The maid service was good, changing all bed linen and towels daily but be aware that if you are sleeping and choose to ignore their knocks, they will promptly telephone your room demanding they come in and clean. After a long day out we decided to have a nap at around 5pm but that was short lived dispite telling the cleaning lady we was sleeping. We was in room 907 with the Nathan Lounge right outside the door where she prefered us to go whilst cleaning. This happended on 2 occasions until she started to come a little eailer whilst we was out. This really wasnt a big deal to me and my Boyfriend,as they have a job to do but to others who want or need thier rest may find this a pain in the neck. As mentioned before, the Nathan Lounge is located on the 9th floor which anyone who books a Nathan room has access too. This includes free tea and coffee and the use of computers, (internet not always working and slow) books and magazines. Great for catching up on emails etc. Breakfast was included in our stay with a variety of choice to suit most people. Hotel staff where helpful and we even booked a couple of tours from the lobby area which where good value. All in all it was a nice stay in a fantasic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: slodh
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very close to MTR Jordan station. Right in the heart of Kowloon, close to TST. Shopping spots like Temple Street are just few blocks away. Plenty of shops and restaurants around the place. It even has the Starbucks on the footsteps. Rooms are fairly sized, and its value for price, as for us, it included breakfast as well. Staff are cordial and supportive

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: OGONTOUR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the 29th June 2008 for 3 Nights en route to Australia. This was my first time in Hong Kong and on the advise of people that had already travelled to Hong Kong before I wanted to base myself in Nathan Road. I decided on the Nathan Hotel and I booked, though their website, a room on their newly renovated Nathan Floor at HK$900 per night (this would have converted to 70 euro at the time) I had also arranged my airport transfer with them prior to my departure costing HK$125 (10 euro) Checking in was straight forward and the staff at the front desk spoke and understood english perfectly. My room was a nice size. The bed was big and comfortable. There was a plasma screen TV mounted on the wall and also a DVD player. There was also a safe which you can set your own combination code for. I loved the bathroom. It was small but it was bright and clean with a really good shower. They also supplied a bathrobe and slippers. The weather was extremely hot while I was there and the air con in the room worked fine. I could not fault the room in any way. Breakfast was included in my rate and was a little disappointing. There was very little selection to choose from and the breakfast room was a little shabby compared to my bedroom although it did look like they were carrying out renovations on that floor so it may well be that the breakfast room has been renovated by now. But there are plenty other options for breakfast near the hotel and there is also a Starbucks located on the ground floor near the reception area and this always looked busy. I also had access to the Nathan Lounge which was located on my floor where there was free internet access, newspapers and self service tea and coffee. Access to this room was with your key card. This hotel is in a great location on the bustling Nathan Road. It was around a 15 minute walk to Kowloon Harbour and the Star Ferry and the Jordan MTR is very near. To me the Nathan Hotel represented excellent value for money in a great location. I found the staff to be helpful when I required any assistance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a bustling location”
Reviews.Author: jdljr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Nathan Hotel, Mar 12-17, 2009. Arrived about 8pm, check-in was very easy, staff was friendly and spoke fluent english. Was assigned room 1311 (Executive). Bellhop escorted us to our room and got us situated. This is when I noticed that the elevators are incredibly slow. When we finally made it to the 13th floor and into our room, I did notice right away that the room had a musty smell but figured that all rooms would, as Hong Kong is humid much of the year. Another thing I noticed right away was that there was ONE accessible plug in the ENTIRE room, under a flip-up lid on the desk. No outlet in the bathroom. So to use my electric razor, the desk in the main room is where I had to be. The room was surprisingly quiet. In fact, our room on the 13th floor of the Nathan was quieter than our room on the 26th floor of another hotel we had previously stayed at in San Francisco a few days before our arrival in Hong Kong. The street noise below was not that noticeable at the Nathan, which, for anyone that's stayed along Nathan Road, is a good thing! On the 3rd night, we encountered a problem with our bedside master control panel (controls the lights, a/c, dnd and make-up room signals). For some reason, the panel was unresponsive; the lights would not go on and the a/c was "stuck" in the on position - could not adjust the temperature. I called down to the front desk to report it and they said they'd send someone. One hour later, no one had arrived to check it (and we were still freezing from the a/c being "stuck" in the on position) so I walked down to the front desk and told them about my call one hour earlier. I then gave them two choices - they could send someone to our room immediately to fix the problem, or move us to a different room, immediately. David at the front desk said for me to go back to the room and if I was still having a problem he'd move us. I went back to the room and tried the control panel again - still unresponsive. I called down to the desk to speak to him and he told us to pack our things and he'd move us to another room. Literally one minute later there was a knock at the door and it was a repair technician. He came in and got into the closet, turned off the master control switch for 10 seconds and then turned it back on. That solved the problem. He left and I quickly called down to speak with David to let him know the problem had been fixed. He insisted on still moving us to a different room for our inconvenience and said he'd personally be up to escort us to the new room. About three minutes later he rang the doorbell and wheeled our luggage out of the room, moving us to room 1211, which appeared to be a Nathan room, even though it wasn't on the 9th floor as the others are (decor was different, TV was a flat panel, more amenities in the room, larger shower, a large desk area, lots of wood paneling walls, upgraded linens). It was a very nice, very much appreciated gesture on their part to rectify the problem. And in David's words, "the problem we encountered with the original room did not meet the expectations we had of the hotel". Moving to the upgraded room really helped to make our last two nights very comfortable. The location was great, just a 5 minute walk to the Jordan MTR Station and less than a 5 minute walk to the Temple Street Night Market. Although Nathan Road is a very busy location, it's a wonderful area to immerse yourself into the bustling city, if that's what you like. The Nathan Hotel also has a free shuttle each morning at 9:00 and 9:30 to the Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry terminal. We frequented the Starbucks a few mornings as well, very convenient to have that connected to the lobby. We did not check out the restaurant or bar, nor did we use their internet service which would have cost us HK$50 for one hour. We did, however, purchase two Hong Kong Disneyland tickets at their tour desk which was a very nice convenience. They tried to sell us a "package" that would include our transportation to the park, however we declined that and just purchased the ticket. The Disneyland ticket was HK$295 each and the transportation would have bumped that up to close to HK$500 each. How they consider that a good value is perplexing, since you can ride the MTR to Disneyland for about HK$16 each, each way. To sum it up, the Nathan Hotel is a friendly hotel providing good value in a great location. Some of the little touches were nice, like the hotel staff that opened the door for us each time we came in our out and the complimentary bottled water in the room. I would probably stay here again, but would likely pay a little more for the Nathan Room to ensure a more comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean room but lacking some amenities”
Reviews.Author: oldshepp
Reviews.Content: Good clean room .Bed was huge but the room was small by Australian standards. There was only ONE power point in the ENTIRE room.This was under a desk and hopeless to use for shaving.No power point on bathroom. Staff were very helpfull . The hotel is located in the centre of Nathan road,5 minutes from Temple st Markets and a short walk from the MTR. We since found better hotels for the same price as we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and lounge”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne63
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the grand room on level 9. Excellent size room and bathroom, certainly up to Australian standards re size and hygeine.House keeping was top class, quick to provide anything that was requested. The lounge facilities were very good, free internet access and was always able to get to a computer. Centrally located to MTR, markets and the harbour. Breakfast included with our room, the menu was varied ,as we stayed 2 wks, this kept it fresh, other meals cheap on the streets.Reception staff friendly and helpful, most spoke english or there was someone around who did.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at nathan hotel and wonderful sightseing 27-30dec08”
Reviews.Author: elijoy
Reviews.Content: With a thorough internet search and since we are staying only for 3 nights,we choose this hotel due to its location.Having read plenty of hotel reviews and comparisons,we found out that it exceeded our expectations.Though we were not accomodated the time we arrived at around 11 am due to unavailability of our booked room(check-in 2pm normal),we were told to come back at 2 pm to be sure that our room is ready.Since the location is just at the busy nathan rd.,we take time for lunch,bit shopping and familiarization of the area,Past 2 pm when we got back at the hotel,we requested a non smoking and preferably on the higher floor which was granted right away. Our big surprised was when they upgraded us to an executive room instead of the superior room plus we previously booked,thanks to the charming lady and kind staff at the reception.We are a small family of four and still it's comfortable even with extra bed,there's wide space for all your stuff.It's always serviced and availability of coffee and tea were daily taken care of.Bell boy and maids did a terrific job.Overall,our stay was a memorable one from check-in to check-out.We will surely stay at this hotel again when we come back,Thanks to the management and staff for a wonderful stay.Here's some tips for first timers and with kids like us:plan your trip early,book on a hotel like nathan which is very close to most transportations like the jordan MTR,double decker buses(from airport they'll drop you close to hotel) and taxisalong nathan road.Travelling's so convenient from here wherever you go to any point of hongkong,just have it with you always from airport the maps,informations and esp.the octupus card where you can use in any trains and buses.Dont forget to visit disneyland and stay late to watch the spectacular fireworks,the famous ocean park,take a cable ride to the golden buddha(pagoda)at tungchung village,an afternoon ride to peak tram to the victoria peak to see the beautiful view of HK,take an afternoon stroll to the avenue of stars at tsim tsa tsui.There were lots of nice places to visit if you have extra days and for those shopping afficionados,there's the night market til 12 pm just close to the hotel where you can buy souveneirs,cheap cloths with quality etc.(like divisoria),giordano and bossini shops were just a walking distance and for bigger shopping malls,try the citigate at tungchung village and the harbour city malls,in tsim tsa tsui ,think youv'e got everything in there.On line search for more information about your trip helps alot such the travel advisor and most important ask a friend who visited the place for more specific informations just what we did and you will have an organise and wonderful stay,thanks to you Tina L. regards from mrmirandacretegreece

Reviews.Title: “Love Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: TBakes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nathan Hotel in September 2008 whilst i was on a trip to Hong Kong with my two best mates. We had chosen the Nathan Hotel as it is located in the cheaper Kowloon area compared to the more expensive Hong Kong Island. Kowloon is a great area, its absolutely buzzing with activity and is lit up in so much Neon during the night its a wonder anyone can get to sleep! By staying in Kowloon it also gave us an opportunity to see a more realistic version of Hong Kong life compared to all the financial and tourist driven environment in Hong Kong Island. The hotel itself is a wonderful place to stay, its modern, clean, full of friendly and helpful staff, and provides great chinese food for both breakfast, lunch,and dinner...although you have to pay extra if you want the latter two meals. There is also a great rooftop bar which has a happy hour each night. It was never really busy in there but was a nice way to end a day of sight seeing. The hotel is located on the busy Nathan Road which leads all the way down to the harbour. Its about a 30minute walk which can sap the life out of you in the midday heat but its still worth doing to see all the hustle and bustle of Kowloon. If you arent the walking type then there is a metro stop 5mins from the hotel which will take you anywhere you need to go in Kowloon and across into Hong Kong Island. As for Hong Kong itself....WOW! I loved it over there, so much to do and see...especially if you like eating and shopping! The view from the peak is amazing and is well worth the visit during the day and night. If you like a night out then you are spoilt for choice, especially in the soho district and Lan Kwai Fong....one tip, if you want greasy burgers/pizza/hot dog/kebabs then go to the 'Cul de Sac' which is down a side alley off Lan Kwai Fong, that place served me well on a night out! For places to visit outside of Hong Kong i recommend going to the Ocean Park theme park located on the other side of HK Island, and visit the giant Bhudda in Lantau. Overall, i loved Hong Kong, and Nathan Hotel is a perfect place to stay for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...not sure”
Reviews.Author: cat666
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see so many positive reviews for this hotel. Maybe we were just unlucky with our room, or perhaps booking a Nathan Room is essential for a good stay. We stayed in one of the regular rooms, and although it was spacious and had a DVD player, I found the bathroom to be exceptionally small, even for Hong Kong standards. The furniture in the sitting area was so cheap that the sofa moved everytime you sat on it. (I swear I'm not fat) On our last night at the hotel, I couldn't find any outlets to plug in my hair straighteners - there weren't any near any mirrors. I haven't any major complaints, but since my stay at the Nathan, I've stayed in much nicer hotels for considerably lower rates. Don't get me wrong, I don't hate this place, I just wasn't as wowed as the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: lilgoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife for 2 nights late October, we booked this hotel from the reviews shown here but I would say that the room was average, our room/bathroom was a little old and worn and the room was tiny for the price we paid. Service was excellent though, both in check-in and at check-out at 4:30 in the morning. We would probably stay there again as it is in an excellent location near Jordan MTR station and close to all the shopping areas, however we didn't consider this one of the better choices we have experienced from recommendations on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhore
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, and very good location. i loved the clean modern rooms with hugh plasma tvs, dvd players and mp3 speakers. beds were so comfy, and the breakfast was really nice with a good selection of food. staff were very friendly. starbucks was down stairs which was nice. We booked on bookings . com and paid a very reasonable price for our 5 night stay. i would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality & location at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: RedEyeDry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nathan Hotel for 3 nights, on the way back to Scotland from Australia. I arrived around 8.30am and my room was ready straight away which was great after my long flight - no hanging around. I stayed in one of the Nathan Rooms which was a good size, nicely done out (modern) with a huge plasma TV which had decent film channels. Good sized bathroom and shower cubicle. Rooms were cleaned and towels changed daily, as was the mini-bar which was affordable (unlike some hotels). I also used the laundry service during my stay - everything was back to me on the same day. Breakfast was included - there was a great variety of delicious food and staff were attentive. Also included with the Nathan Room was access to a lounge, with complimentary drinks and internet access. It's located right on Nathan Road and near Jordan MTR station - it's easy enough to get around on foot though, as it's near most of the main Kowloon sites and it's a short walk to the harbour. This hotel was of a really good standard and I couldn't believe how reasonably priced it was too, even with extras such as mini-bar and laundry. I would really recommend this as a great all-round place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: travelholic02
Reviews.Content: My mom and I was travelling to Hong Kong on a shopping trip so we wanted to be in a great location. The check in was fast and people were very friendly. Our room was on the 10th floor which we had a pretty good view. The room was small but it was very morden and clean. The room was fully aircon. We could not open the door because it would be too noisey with the traffic sounds outside. The hotel was very near the night market and the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: reizlovesuglytoys
Reviews.Content: I have got to admit, for the price that i'm forking out, the hotel is really valuable for money! Close Proximity to Jordan MTR (Which has some really good food) and just 2 stops away from Mongkok MTR. And yes, the front desk got to do something about their attitude i suppose. The lady who helped us with the "check in" wasn't very friendly. Stayed in the Executive Room, wanted to upgrade to Nathan Room but the front desk shown no signs of willingness to help at all. But o well, The room is clean. The bedding is the kind that i like so no complains! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: bakerbass
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel, which was very well situated in Kowloon. After reading other trip advisor comments, I stayed in a room on the Nathan floor and was extremely impressed by the quality of the room as well as the 42 inch plasma screen tv mounted on the wall and the free internet. The service at the front desk really lacked something, but if you treat the hotel as serviced apartments, you couldn't ask for better for the very cheap prices that they are asking.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Spami
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have been in Hong Kong and we were looking for a good hotel in Kowloon where we can easily access the MTR and Nathan Road for purposes of traveling Hong Kong, without having to pay the exorbitent prices of the harbour hotels. After loads of research we decided to book a Nathan Room in the Nathan Hotel, including breakfast, on the "Rates-to-Go" website. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the room, which had a lovely view of Nathan Road, and the modern look and feel. Make sure though that you book on the 9th Floor, as this floor has the new upgraded rooms and also a private lounge. The breakfast restaurant is in the process of being renovated and can do with a new decor, but the breakfast was much better than what previous comments made it out to be and we enjoyed having a glimpse of the harbour from the penthouse restaurant. If you are not looking for a harbour view hotel (which comes with an extra price tag) and wish to be in the hub of Natan road and Temple Street, the the Nathan Hotel comes recommended. It is also one of the few hotels that offer a all-inclusive breakfast rate, all other hotels seems to charge an extra amount.

Reviews.Title: “Our nice stay @ Nathan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mheemhoo
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at Nathan Hotel for 3 nights. We booked the summer executive room promotion so we got free internet access in our room and late check-out until 2pm which was great! We took A21 bus from the airport and it took us about 30-45 min to get to the hotel and the bus stop is just right there in front of our hotel. (If you will stay at this hotel, I would recommend you to go by bus than by MTR since you will have to carry your luggage up and down the stairs and walk to the hotel.) Nathan Hotel is located in a good area, it took us only 3-5 min. walk from the hotel to Jordan MTR Station which is only 2 blocks away. You can also walk from the hotel to Tsim Sha Tsui, Harbour City, Victoria Harbour and Mong Kok and you will find lots of shopping places on the way there. The night market is on the other side of the road, just cross the road and you will find it along with many good eating places. Well, it was our first time at this hotel and we found it a very nice place to be in HK. The room has a good size for HK hotels, it’s a lot bigger than other hotels I have stayed before. We had plenty of space to lay our luggages and our shopping bags. The hotel is very clean, the bed was neatly made and the new fresh towels were replaced in the bathroom for us everyday. The wardrobe is well-designed so it doesn’t fill up the room space. It has enough space and hangings for our clothes. Inside the wardrobe is a safe box which you can easily fix your own code, very convenient. On the bedside desk, you will find an electronic controller which you can easily control the air-condition’s temperature and fan, all room lights, radio and TV. I have read from other reviews for Nathan Hotel that the room is dark but my girlfriend and I didn’t find the same problem in our room. Our room had a stand light, a table light, two bed lights (left & right), a night light (a very soft light from the top of the bed) and a corridor light which could lighten up our room and gave enough light for the night time. The bathroom is again bigger than other hotels I have stayed before. You will have a large wash basin counter, surely enough for all your toiletries. You will also be daily provided toilet amenities; toothbrush & toothpaste, soap, comb, shower cap, cotton buds, shower gel, shampoo & conditioner and body lotion. Well, if you decide to stay at Nathan Hotel, don’t forget to visit the Bali Bar on the top floor. It can help you cool down after your long day shopping. The bar serves all types of beverages with the nice sweet music and cool air. One more tip: buy OCTOPUS Card before you leave the airport. You can use this card to pay for bus fee, tram fee, The Peak Tram fee (don’t have to queue up and wait to buy the ticket) and many other places do accept this card as well. It’s very convenient and no need to use cash. You can easily top up your card credit by using the automatic machine in any MTR stations.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: moobox82
Reviews.Content: booking through the hotel website 2 weeks before my arrival to hk, i chose the nathan room. so after a few checks i changed my mind, so i modified my application to a bigger room which is nathan grand room, through the same place where i made my booking earlier. when i arrived, nobody greeted me. they were chatting and laughing at the counter while i stand alone looking at them. they only responded when i said 'hey'. after all the things were done at the front desk, i went up to my room to see that it was the wrong room i wanted, so i called up the reception and asked wat type of room this is. they lied and said 'it's nathan grand room'. i was very disappointed and told them ithis is normal nathan room, and not the grand room. i went back to the front desk to explain i did a modification, while a staff were trying to amend, 2 other staffs were at her back whispering in cantonese how troublesome i am plus few rude remarks. bet they did not know i travel to hk too much, thats why i can makeout wat they were trying to say. so i was told i have to wait an hr before my correct room is ready, 2 hrs passed and nobody got back to me. i have to approach the desk again, get the right key to the right room, and nobody apologised to me when it's their booking system in the computer that screwed up. overall cheap getaway with big rooms but service wise... dont think bout it.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy my stay at Nathan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggavalas
Reviews.Content: We booked the Nathan Hotel through our travel agent as we were traveling to Hong Kong for our Honeymoon. The lobby of the Nathan looked fine but there were many things I did not like when we got to our room: 1 - They gave us 2 single beds (being on our honeymoon I found this ridiculous). After telling management they still couldnt understand what the issue was till i started raising my voice. 2 - the bathroom was discusting - the toilet wouldnt even flush! 3 - We couldnt make it to breakfast one morning as we had a tour booked so instead of a tasty breakfast we were brought a plain cheese sadwhich to our room which they left on our bed and did not place in the fridge. Overall management were rude and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: bmoregirl
Reviews.Content: Using the Hotel Desk in the Hong Kong International Airport we found Nathans Hotel. It was an awesome experience. The rooms are big for Hong Kong. The location is great, the staff friendly, and the amenties are wonderful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in TsimTsatsui”
Reviews.Author: rwintour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nathan Hotel for 4 nights as recommended by my office friend with consideration this hotel has undergone significant renovation. Since the first step into this hotel, the impression of the hotel was quite good. The receptionist had been very helpful, once they helped me to have a conversation over the phone with an attendant of the shop in Hong Kong island that I was trying to locate till to get information of the Indonesian resto around the area. I stayed at its nathan grand room on Nathan floor. It has 34 sqm room area with its flat screen tv and dvd player, in short the room is good, clean, well maintained, nicely decorated just as good as it appears on its website.. The hotel offers good location in Tsimshatsui, close to Jordan MTR station and local shops and eateries almost open round the clock... The improvement should be made by the hotel is its bfast place in its top floor with not too appetizing menu......fortunately Starbuck just adjacent to its lobby In short, this hotel is suitable for mid-budget and travelers that loves to be in Kowloon side....

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for not expensive yet reasonable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKTN
Reviews.Content: Looked at multiple places to stay for 3nts. Chose this one on (i) images I saw on website and (ii) cost of room in multiple websites. In HKG, it is really hard to compare 3&4 star hotels given you may not get what you expect. For this hotel, I would stay here again. It is non in TST tourist area, but if you plan to take MTR and bus anyway, this location is middle of where you plan to go. (Near north of street market or south to TST). It is highly a must you choose the NATHAN floor and possibly spurge on the GRAND room with a bigger bed. The floors (9 and above) have been completely renovated. It is only $20+ more and definately worth the extra (cleaner room, newer beds, flat screen), etc... It comes with complimentary breakfast on the 14+th floor. I read from before reviews the breakfast is not all that - it was true however for me, definately good enough to fill up your stomach (eggs, bread, pasta, fruits) before hitting the streets. When you come to HKG, who wants to eat in a hotel anyway. For us, the breakfast was worth it (standard with Nathan room, I wouldn't pay 100HKG for it though) given what I can get outside. Finally, the 9th floor has a small lounge for some beverages (coffee, juice) and internet access. I would stay again here just on cost and cleaniest/ recently renovated rooms!! BTW>> we had a 7mos child with us, they offered us a baby bed free of charge which was a good surprised. The staff was very friendly and the room has a safe big enough for your laptop, passports which is key!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynwa
Reviews.Content: Date May 19th We had a 3 night stay at the Nathan Hotel on the way home to the Gold Coast we booked a Nathan Grand Room and was up graded to a Nathan King Suite, very spacious, 2 flat televisions, use of free computer, everything you needed, it was fantastic, staff very friendly, breakfast ok Close to Night and Jade Markets

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: marc_andre24
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3nights, and were extremely pleased with the quality of the room and service. the room was of good size and had all the extra add ons that you could need. i would highly recommend this hotel. reasonable but yet suprisingly comfy and sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: palacegal
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Hong Kong, we thought the hotel was good value for money and is ideally located on Nathan road, near to the night markets and only a few blocks from the MTR. Staff at reception were friendly and hepful (I used their services immediately as I had forgotten the key to the padlock for my case, the concierge found some boltcutters and cut it off for me!), and they all spoke good English. We stayed in a Nathan room which was newly decorated and spacious with a huge bed. The bathroom was also big but seemed a little outdated compared to the rest of the decor, lots of toiletries provided though We stayed on the 10th floor, and there was no view to speak of, but we didn't care ( what do you expect in the middle of the city?) We didn't eat at the restaurant, but the roof top bar was fantastic- the perfect place to wind down after the noise of the city. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby. Overall, a great place and I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnMyLastLegs
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 9 days and it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were recently renovated, and it was huge by hotel standards. Decoration was pleasant and the furnishings were comfortable. The only let-down was the television which was an old CRT. It was not even flat screen. The room was on the 5th. floor, overlooking the busy Nathan Road. There was slight humming sound coming from the traffic below but not intrusive. The Bali Bar on the top floor was a very pleasant place to cool down after a long day of walking. Tried the gym but I was the only one there. The staff were friendly, efficient but not intrusive. This hotel is very conveniently located along busy Nathan Road, with Jordon Station around the corner and Tsim Sah Tsui Station about 5 mins walk. The famous Temple Street Market is just across the road, about 2 mins walk. I spend most of my time out of the hotel, and only came back in the evenings, so this hotel is perfect for the intreipid traveller. All in all, a nice little gem. Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: frenchtra
Reviews.Content: Good location and close from MTR Jordan station but with incovenient of town noise. You are in Koolown downcenter! Ask for the Nathan floor which will give you the last renovated rooms with access to th small lounge and free internet access. Breakfast is not the best you can find but included into the price of the room i am sure you have on of the best ration for Koolown / Hong Kong. Rooms are really confortable and fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: garudaJakarta
Reviews.Content: We stayed fr 1st Jan till 5th Jan, Service were ok, we stayed in the old room with King bed size. The bathroom were clean but relatively small. We book thru asiatravel.com The room was clean & good service, except some of the staff don't understand English. The hotel is very close to Jordan mtr station & at night behind the Wing on plaza they have a night market with a very cheap seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: supaberri
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 13th floor. It was really large and clean. The hotel is really close to Jordan MTR and the hotel also offers a complimentary service to the harbour area. On a slight negative note I was not impressed by the breakfasts or by the service on the rooftop bar - however there are plenty of alternatives available locally. Great value for money and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: louandsteve
Reviews.Content: The Nathan Hotel is in just the right location on Nathan Rd with the added bonus of having a starbucks attached!! The Rooms are very clean with a contempory feel the flat screen tv attached to the wall could be mistaken for a mirror it was that big!!! The Breakfast was lovely but did'nt quite fancy fried rice that early!!! but there was lots to chose from. The Bali bar on the 14 floor is a must to visit after a days shopping/sight seeing sat on the wonderfull sofa's sipping a cosmopoliton was my favourite place to round the day off. The staff are quite helpfull but can be very blinkered. Would recommend this hotel to anybody, I would return again

Reviews.Title: “Choice location with good service”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSlung
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Nathan Grand rooms from 22 Sep for 3 nights. As the rooms are recently renovated, we find them to be exceptionally clean and comfortable. They are also spacious compared with other HK hotels which gave my two year old son plenty of room to run about. We took the promotional package that came with a nice buffet breakfast for two at HKD800++. We had access to the Nathan Lounge that offer free drinks, tarts and internet. The computer in the lounge came in handy as I used it to download the pictures and videos which we took with our digital camera daily into USB sticks. The location is excellent as it is a short walk to the Jordan MTR and anywhere we want to get good Cantonese dim sum. Even getting around in taxi is cheaper and easy as the Nathan is located right in the heart of Kowloon. The staff are friendly, greeting us almost every corner of the building. But Benny Mak stood out as he is always so friendly and recommended us to some good places to go. Yes, choice hotel for choice location with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big room, good service”
Reviews.Author: Warrina
Reviews.Content: Had booked a standard room but it had a separate sitting room with an additional TV, so it was more like a suite. Fluffy bathrobes, big bathroom, very clean. The airport bus ($33/person) dropped us on Nathan Rd, very close to the hotel. Leaving HK we had an early departure, so we booked the hotel transport, $120/person, to make life even easier. Plenty of buses and Jordan station nearby, but we ended up doing a lot of walking. Probably about a 20 minute walk to the harbour. Temple St market close to the hotel. Friendly and attentive staff in reception. Breakfast buffet a bit ordinary, otherwise everything great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and close to MTR”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nathan in May. The hotel had construction going on during the day. But I was never there during the day so it was not a problem at all. The rooms are okay. The beds are pretty comfy. The night front desk clerk was hard to understand english. We had been in China for 2 weeks and Hong Kong was our last stop. Having to decipher what the clerk was saying was no big deal after two weeks. For someone just arriving, it could be a big deal. The hotel is located about one block away from the Jordan MTR. There's a Starbucks right around the corner. There's also a couple of places to eat in the area. The breakfast buffet was very expensive at the hotel. $95HK per person. We did not eat there. The bar on the 15th floor is nice. A little get-away from the hustle bustle. Drinks were good. The weather was very hot and humid as it had rained for a week and stopped the night we arrived. Overall, the stay at the hotel was fine for the price. Tons of shopping every where. Would recommend that you find out where SOHO is. Great place to hang out for dinner, dancing, and live music.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: trixiebear
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say about this one in some ways. Ended up here as due to a jewelery fair, or whatever was the latest excuse, hotels in HK were either booked up or had doubled their rates. That pretty much applied to the Nathan which was overpriced at what I paid but fine at the I saw being quoted for the following week - half the price nearly. Room was a decent size for a hotel of this type and more importantly they'd made sensible use of space. Didn't see in room internet but was only there for one night so didn't really bother. It is convenient for the MTR. Local area was the typical wall to wall concrete & neon that is Hong Kong. Not bad if you get it at normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jena109
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here Nov 9th - 17th. When we got to the hotel they did not have the room we booked available (triple occupancy). The manager gave us a 1 bedroom suite instead, the biggest one on the floor. We had 1 tv in the room with 2 twin beds & a separte living room area with 2 couches & another tv. They sent a rollaway bed for the 3rd person which was pretty darn comfortable. The staff are super friendly and also speak fluent english. Maid was extra nice as well and our room was cleaned everyday and anything we had requested was done. I would definitely stay here again and would highly reccomend to others. Rooms seem to be bigger then average HK rooms from the floorplan we've seen in our room. Our room was definitely much bigger then the average room in US. I would compare the size of our suite to the size of room at Venetian Suite in Vegas(if not bigger). Locations was also great. Literally right across the street from Temple Street night market & close to subway stations. There's a restaurant just down the street from the hotel that i would highly recommend as well. The Swiss chicken was great.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Karen78
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Nathan Hotel for a 2 night stay, slightly apprehensive after reading mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. Booked through Hotels.com and got two rooms for four adults for $396 USD which was approx £52/room/night. After reading reviews regarding the size of the rooms, we were expecting to be given rooms the size of shoeboxes, especially as we did not book through the Hotel direct. We arrived at the hotel from the airport on the A21 bus, which was cheap and straightforward. It stopped approximately 50 yards from the Hotel entrance, which is slightly off Nathan Road. The lobby was very impressive and both reception staff and bell boys were very helpful. We were advised we were being given rooms with an interconnecting door which they would open for us if we wished. On arrival at the rooms, we were pleasantly surprised at both the size and the decor of the rooms. They were very clean, very spacious and had extra touches such as slippers and nice toiletries. The rooms we were in 1006/1007 looked like they had been newly refurbished. There was no noise at night and the beds were very comfortable. The Hotel Bar - The Bali Bar is on the roof and was very impressive. It was very well decorated and was quiet when we were there for happy hour. We had a look at the Hotel restaurant, which looked lovely but had quite a limited menu and was no use for our fussy Mum. We booked two tours through the hotel travel desk, a full day Po Lin Monastery and Big Buddah tour and a half day city tour. Both were an excellent way of seeing Hong Kong when you are on a tight time schedule. We visited the night market and Ladies market which were both excellent and bargains were there to be had! Overall we had an excellent stay at the Nathan Hotal and would have no hesitation in going back or recommending to anyone else. We may have been lucky with the rooms we had, but we can only comment on the experience we had. The photo we took does not do the room justice.

Reviews.Title: “BigBear”
Reviews.Author: BigBear,TH
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, Room quite new, accross the street have night market and food, 5 mins walk to Jardan MRT station, recommend to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rusted Coffee Pot/Boiling Water Pot”
Reviews.Author: badbatzmaru
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights from Sept 18-22, 2006. Part of a package: airfare + included hotel. Check in was fine, though you can expect a minor wait of about 10 minutes. It seems like there's only 1-2 person doing check in's and 2-3 other people running around like a chicken with their heads chopped off. For some reason, they ran out of king beds and gave us (2 couples), 2 rooms each with 2 twin/full size beds. This was fine with us. But my girlfriend would've preferred a king bed. I insisted that we get the remodeled rooms and they obliged. I suspected if I had not asked we would've gotten a non remodeled room. Bellhop, maid, etc. all did a good job. ***Major disappointment/let down*** On the 2nd and 3rd day, I was getting a stomach ache in the morning around 9 am. I suspected it must have been the hong kong drinking water. For the past 2 weeks, I bought bottled water and boiled it in the hot pots provided througout the trip in China . But once I went to hong kong and checked in to this hotel, i used the tap water to boil water daily to make tea. My girlfriend's parents thought it was okay. On the 4th day, I opened the boiling water pot and noticed it was all rusted inside. DISGUSTING. I took 2 pictures for you all to see. I suspected this is what caused my stomach to ache, but of course, could have been the tap water also. Nonetheless, this is a serious flaw in that the housekeeper should have known and/or caught it. Cause she did emptied the water pot daily and washed the tea cups. So my tip: please check out the coffee/water pot pot before you use it. Wash, rinse it, boil water in it a couple of times before using and most importantly, check for rust, contamination, or skip entirely and drink something from a bottle. My weakness is that I love to drink hot tea daily. This gets my "system" going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinvin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nathan Hotel for 3 Nights. When I first got there, they gave me a Standard Twin SHaring room with a rollover bed. Apparently if you have only 2 persons, the standard twin sharing bedroom would look good as there would be enough space for 2. But if added a rollover bed plus an additional person, you would find lesser space to put your bags and walk about, not to mention they have 2 chairs and a coffee table in the room too. Anyway I called the counter to request for a 3 standard beds as I believed that the price I paid was menat for 3 standard bed in superior room. Having my namecard helped me as I was from a Travel Agency in SIN. I managed to get ourselves a superior Triple share room though it was a smoking area (I suspected they gave us standard twin room cos the non smoking Triple Superior was not available). Comments for those inend to have 3 shared room, get the superior Triple. Bigger and more comfortable. The toliet is bigger than the standard twin too. See pics for more.

Reviews.Title: “great location and a great value”
Reviews.Author: dangin
Reviews.Content: I was a little reluctant to stay here after reading some of the reviews but I can say that I was pleasantly surprised that the naysayers were definitely wrong. The Nathan Hotel is a solid 3 star hotel that offers a real value especially with being located in such a bustling shopping area and with public transportation in abundance nearby. Located in a bustling area in Kowloon where wondrous shopping opportunities abound, the Nathan Hotel has not only withstood the test of time, but also proven itself to be a solid contender in an area where "hotels" aren't exactly up to snuff by Western standards. We've stayed here twice, actually. Our first room was a standard 2 (twin-sized) bed room. No real frills, but it was very clean and like most Chinese hotels, slippers, toothbrushes, cheap shoe shine kits, and the like were also provided. Unlike some other hotels in HK, the room was not a sardine can. There was also a minifridge, that like most minifridges, if you consume anything from it, you're going to pay a premium. Go pick up some drinks outside at 7-11 and stock it yourself. The second stay we had was in an upgraded 2 bed room that we received as a free upgrade. The room had a sitting area with a loveseat and a chair. It also had a 2nd TV and a hanging rack for clothes. A nice touch, however do note that there is no iron in the room so either bring your own or pick up one for cheap at a local store. The front desk staff was very young, but attentive and helpful in helping us locate particular areas of interest. Internet access is available via a couple of computers on the ground floor with a pricetag of 50 HKD for 1 hour access. Not a great price as there are a couple of cramped internet cafes within 10 mins walking, but definitely more convenient than them as well. I didn't try the Bali restaurant/bar on the 15th floor as there are plenty of places from hole in the wall joints to the upscale all within footsteps of the hotel. For those that need a coffee fix, there's even a Starbucks connected to the hotel on the ground floor. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at the Nathan Hotel. While I wish there was an iron in my room, it was so humid in HK in July that the wrinkles went away on their own.

Reviews.Title: “well located but the hotel ?????????????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room never seen on internet or review. Got to pay even for a bootle of water ut if your smart near by a Welcome store dont accept Americain traverlers check Restaurant minus 4 star Only good thing: hearth of Kooloong if room not important well Ok

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over easter for about a week and the room size was quite small, but had expected that. The rooms and hotel in general smelt like cigarettes pungently, very overpowering and sickening. The hotel staff were probably the rudest people i had the misfortune of meeting. They were rude, inconsiderate, no manners, preferably spoke to asian tourists only and when confronted about a problem made the whole ordeal seem like it was our fault (card would not work to gain entry to the door). Please please please, do NOT, and i mean do NOT dine in the restaurant for breakfast. The same 5 dishes (egg/rice/noodles, small sausages and ham) every single morning for six days. To get a glass of orange juice sent the restaurant into meltdown, with no saff knowing where anything was nor wanting to get anything (waiting 10 minutes for a glass to have the orange juice that took another 10 minutes to find-- with the restuarant completely empty of people). Good things abouit this place: Location.... thats it. This hotel is not worthy of the prices it charges. Please save your money for something else... anything else (eaton looked quite good from the outside). With this hotel it lacked everything and is not even remotely like the pictures on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic size rooms”
Reviews.Author: grapmybags
Reviews.Content: Don’t believe the photos on their web site, they must be their suites. These are smallest rooms in the world out of hundreds I’ve stayed in. Such a disappointment, I chose this hotel for location and having never been to Hong Kong before I thought it would matter but it doesn’t, many of the other hotels I considered were all within one to five minutes walk away. I arrived late at night, went to bed and woke up sweating in unbearable heat discovering my air-conditioning didn’t work, tried to ring the front desk to then find my phone didn’t work either. I marched down to the front desk at 4am to be told it would be looked at in the morning. It was to hot to sleep that night, the next day they assigned me a new even smaller room with no apologies or sorry for the in-convince etc at all. This new room was even smaller, I had to move my suitcase stand every time to go into the bathroom, if my wife came with me we couldn’t have laid out two suitcases at all. Save your money there is far many better hotels in Kowloon to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: mgershenson
Reviews.Content: Nice furnishings in room, but my God, it's small! I set up a corporate account with these guys, and I can't imagine putting my 300lb boss in one of these phone booth size rooms. Looked like it had been recently refurbished, and the staff was very attentive. Had 2 bad meals in the restaraunt, I would not recommend eating there. Very poor service for both dinner and breakfast, and really bad steak at dinner. if I stayed again, I'd go out. I won't say don't stay here, as the room was very nice aside from the size, but know what you're getting before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Room almost the size of my Walkin Closet !”
Reviews.Author: arcticnite
Reviews.Content: Be careful with this hotel. Location is good on Nathan Road, but you can be booked into a room almost the size of my 'walkin' closet ! There appear to be two wings; a 5 floor section and a larger 15 floor tower. I was in the 5 floor section. The larger tower may not have received the recent million dollar remodeling; as the front desk indicated these were the 'standard' rooms. Usually stay at the Shangri-La, but recenty my visits have only been for 12 hours, so am looking for an affordable alternative to the fabulous Shangri-La. This is not it. I booked thru Expedia's Asia partner...eLong. They promoted a Deluxe Room for about $100. The room turned out to be exceedingly small. Alright for one person; two people would be stepping on each other. The marketing is deceptive; which resulted in my poor rating. When I questioned the front desk they said it was a 'Deluxe' room. I was skeptical. The Floor diagram (Fire Escape information) shows a couple of these rooms in the 20sq meter range, the rest on the floor appear to be in the 30+sq meter range. Appears they save the small rooms for Internet reservations. I would expect more of these rooms on each floor. The room was recently remodled and the furnishings, carpet and bathroom are quite nice. Coffee service in room and a limited mini bar with a beer and soft drinks. Nice high tech control box next to bed which allows you to monitor and control everything from lights to air conditioning. The lobby of the hotel is sparce and small. No reason to lounge around. Its either to your room or on the street. Starbucks is attached, so coffee is a snap, athough they don't open until 7:30am. There is no CNN; only CNBC and Bloomberg Financial english channels. Room service is avaiable from 7am until 11 pm. The restaurant is located on the 15th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ok room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Nathan is right off of Nathan - the main street in Hong Kong. It's very close to the Jordon station at the MTR, so it's great if you want to get around town easily. The lobby has been updated but some of the rooms have not. The rooms are circa 1970 - especially the hairdryers! The beds are comfortable though and there was enough space to open 2 bags and still walk around. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Good value if you're looking for something in town with a good location.

HotelInfo.Name: Nathan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.378 Nathan Rd, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
